title: sustainable design of social housing
desc: design and build a prototype of social housing emphasizing all those elements that will condition the use of energy in the useful life of these buildings. incorporate the necessary elements to achieve social housing that has an optimal energy performance and serves as a model for other social housing applications in the city.
title+desc: sustainable design of social housing. design and build a prototype of social housing emphasizing all those elements that will condition the use of energy in the useful life of these buildings. incorporate the necessary elements to achieve social housing that has an optimal energy performance and serves as a model for other social housing applications in the city.

title: promotion of photovoltaic solar installations for distributed generation
desc: develop a platform for linking and associating supply-demand to promote an economy of scale that, leveraged also with subsidized financing for the acquisition of equipment, reduces costs and promotes residential, commercial and industrial distributed generation. through the use of this platform, successive calls will be made to generate groups of joint purchase of goods and services, to which the costs of acquiring them will be partially subsidized.

title: strengthening cifa (environmental information and training center) as a benchmark in clean generation technologies
desc: it seeks to position the center for environmental information and training (cifa) as a local and national reference node in the training and technological aspects of urban applications of energy sources, also generating local knowledge from the promotion of research, development and innovation.
title+desc: strengthening cifa (environmental information and training center) as a benchmark in clean generation technologies. it seeks to position the center for environmental information and training (cifa) as a local and national reference node in the training and technological aspects of urban applications of energy sources, also generating local knowledge from the promotion of research, development and innovation.

title: community solar generation with broad social impact
desc: technical-economic study for the implementation of a community solar generation model in new social housing in vulnerable neighborhoods of the city of buenos aires. making photovoltaic installations of scale, reducing costs and repayment periods, bringing the option of investment in this technology to all the inhabitants of the city, and economically benefiting the owners of the roofs of social buildings, by reducing their energy costs and removing the risk of energy poverty. generation of green employment associated with the activity of these facilities.
title+desc: community solar generation with broad social impact. technical-economic study for the implementation of a community solar generation model in new social housing in vulnerable neighborhoods of the city of buenos aires. making photovoltaic installations of scale, reducing costs and repayment periods, bringing the option of investment in this technology to all the inhabitants of the city, and economically benefiting the owners of the roofs of social buildings, by reducing their energy costs and removing the risk of energy poverty. generation of green employment associated with the activity of these facilities.

title: solar map of the city
desc: develop a tool to provide information to citizens and public managers on the possibility of generating renewable energy in defined points of the city and on the economic, environmental and social benefits that this generates.
title+desc: solar map of the city. develop a tool to provide information to citizens and public managers on the possibility of generating renewable energy in defined points of the city and on the economic, environmental and social benefits that this generates.

title: portal web retrofit caba
desc: develop a web portal where all the information related to "retrofit" is centralized, which would fulfill a function of repository of general information to guide the citizen, provide technical information and guides of good practices for professionals, and orientation service. promotion of list of suppliers, professionals, financing lines, offer product discounts.
title+desc: portal web retrofit caba. develop a web portal where all the information related to "retrofit" is centralized, which would fulfill a function of repository of general information to guide the citizen, provide technical information and guides of good practices for professionals, and orientation service. promotion of list of suppliers, professionals, financing lines, offer product discounts.

title: learning networks
desc: improve the energy performance of neighborhood clubs and contribute to the sustainability of clubs and their important social function. it is intended to create a collaboration space where representatives of neighborhood clubs that need to implement energy efficiency and renewable energy measures participate. the economic contribution of at least 30% of the total cost necessary to intervene with the proposed measures is required.
title+desc: learning networks. improve the energy performance of neighborhood clubs and contribute to the sustainability of clubs and their important social function. it is intended to create a collaboration space where representatives of neighborhood clubs that need to implement energy efficiency and renewable energy measures participate. the economic contribution of at least 30% of the total cost necessary to intervene with the proposed measures is required.

title: sewen - metropolitan monitoring platform
desc: monitor centrally and in real time the status and evolution of the set of photovoltaic installations in the city, with information on generation, status, maintenance requirements (preventive and corrective), alert and rapid response to failures, also serving as a tool for governance and dissemination of clean technologies.
title+desc: sewen - metropolitan monitoring platform. monitor centrally and in real time the status and evolution of the set of photovoltaic installations in the city, with information on generation, status, maintenance requirements (preventive and corrective), alert and rapid response to failures, also serving as a tool for governance and dissemination of clean technologies.

title: rosario dry biodigestion plant
desc: the municipality of rosario has an ambitious comprehensive waste management plan that, although it is dynamic over the years since its creation in 2003 to date, the spirit is always the same, minimize the generation of waste, reduce waste sent to final disposal through different treatments according to each stream of material,  among other purposes. the process of the organic fraction is necessary to take if it is intended to decrease in final disposal. this fraction is around 40/50% of the generation of household solid waste, for this reason, the municipality has had a composting plant for more than 7 years. the technical teams of the ministry of environment and public space developed this project of dry biodigestion plant with the purpose of increasing the amount of waste recovered with more advanced and innovative technologies, continue with the use of the dry fraction (recyclable materials), with the added value of generating electricity.
title+desc: rosario dry biodigestion plant. the municipality of rosario has an ambitious comprehensive waste management plan that, although it is dynamic over the years since its creation in 2003 to date, the spirit is always the same, minimize the generation of waste, reduce waste sent to final disposal through different treatments according to each stream of material,  among other purposes. the process of the organic fraction is necessary to take if it is intended to decrease in final disposal. this fraction is around 40/50% of the generation of household solid waste, for this reason, the municipality has had a composting plant for more than 7 years. the technical teams of the ministry of environment and public space developed this project of dry biodigestion plant with the purpose of increasing the amount of waste recovered with more advanced and innovative technologies, continue with the use of the dry fraction (recyclable materials), with the added value of generating electricity.

title: sustainable and energy-efficient municipal building
desc: sustainable construction of a municipal building that complies with leed standards and energy efficiency parameters.
title+desc: sustainable and energy-efficient municipal building. sustainable construction of a municipal building that complies with leed standards and energy efficiency parameters.

title: renewable energy at the vicente lópez university center
desc: implementation of an energy efficiency system and use of solar energy in the university center of vicente lópez.
title+desc: renewable energy at the vicente lópez university center. implementation of an energy efficiency system and use of solar energy in the university center of vicente lópez.

title: electric fleet and charging stations
desc: it seeks to install electric charging stations and make the replacement of the municipal fleet to electric or hybrid vehicles.
title+desc: electric fleet and charging stations. it seeks to install electric charging stations and make the replacement of the municipal fleet to electric or hybrid vehicles.

title: installation of solar panels
desc: it seeks to cover the equivalent of an area of 2500 m2 with the installation of 680 solar panels (450w each), which means 300 kw of installed power. with the right inclination of 10 degrees and installed coplanar to roof would generate 447,788 kwh per year. this project represents an emission saving of 206 tons of co2 per year. the project currently has funding for a power of 100 kw and financing is sought for 200 kw more.
title+desc: installation of solar panels. it seeks to cover the equivalent of an area of 2500 m2 with the installation of 680 solar panels (450w each), which means 300 kw of installed power. with the right inclination of 10 degrees and installed coplanar to roof would generate 447,788 kwh per year. this project represents an emission saving of 206 tons of co2 per year. the project currently has funding for a power of 100 kw and financing is sought for 200 kw more.

title: comprehensive solid waste management plan
desc: it aims to make the concept of the circular economy viable, promoting sustainability and the use of scarce resources. thus, in the current and proposed management of waste, the minimization, reuse and recycling of the waste generated are taken as premises. to this end, the comprehensive management plan for urban solid waste (girsu) was developed in order to comply with current regulations, specifically provincial law no. 13,592.
title+desc: comprehensive solid waste management plan. it aims to make the concept of the circular economy viable, promoting sustainability and the use of scarce resources. thus, in the current and proposed management of waste, the minimization, reuse and recycling of the waste generated are taken as premises. to this end, the comprehensive management plan for urban solid waste (girsu) was developed in order to comply with current regulations, specifically provincial law no. 13,592.

title: garbage
desc: waste treatment centre
title+desc: garbage. waste treatment centre

title: composting center of salvador
desc: create a composting center for the receipt of pruning waste and household organic waste, which also functions as an environmental education center. together, implement programs to encourage small composting (composting in schools of the municipal education network and program to encourage condominium-residential and commercial composting) and centralized model (large plants for the treatment of fair waste, pruning of municipal green areas and household waste).
title+desc: composting center of salvador. create a composting center for the receipt of pruning waste and household organic waste, which also functions as an environmental education center. together, implement programs to encourage small composting (composting in schools of the municipal education network and program to encourage condominium-residential and commercial composting) and centralized model (large plants for the treatment of fair waste, pruning of municipal green areas and household waste).

title: implement ecological corridors
desc: corridors are essential for landscape protection, listed property, conservation units, maintenance of historical traditions and to ensure maintenance of ecosystem services and minimization of the consequences of climate change in the region. the creation of ecological corridors, also foreseen in action 49.10 of the salvador resilience strategy, aims to implement vegetated spaces that interconnect areas affected by human activity, aiming at the conservation of biodiversity through the displacement of animals, seed dispersal and increased vegetation cover. this initiative is part of the set of actions considered as priorities to achieve the specific objectives of the pmma. part of the strategy for preserving the transatlantic forest is to create a balance between the increase of the urban tourist experience, the preservation of ecosystem services and the awareness of the theme.
title+desc: implement ecological corridors. corridors are essential for landscape protection, listed property, conservation units, maintenance of historical traditions and to ensure maintenance of ecosystem services and minimization of the consequences of climate change in the region. the creation of ecological corridors, also foreseen in action 49.10 of the salvador resilience strategy, aims to implement vegetated spaces that interconnect areas affected by human activity, aiming at the conservation of biodiversity through the displacement of animals, seed dispersal and increased vegetation cover. this initiative is part of the set of actions considered as priorities to achieve the specific objectives of the pmma. part of the strategy for preserving the transatlantic forest is to create a balance between the increase of the urban tourist experience, the preservation of ecosystem services and the awareness of the theme.

title: solar park
desc: the project is the construction of a photovoltaic generating system (a solar farm) through the installation of solar panels in the park of canabrava and in the ceilings of brt stations, generating an installed power of 5mw, for the use of the city hall in public lighting and energy consumption of municipal public buildings. the system will be operated under a onerous concession or ppp regime, in order to supply a significant part of the energy demand of the municipal public administration, through demand assurance and energy management and subsequent reversal of the asset to the city hall, at the end of the concessionperiod (build-operate-transfer). with this pilot project of solar farm, the city hall aims to originate a business model that is, at the same time, attractive to the market and with appropriate counterparts to the public interest, comprising the following premises of socioeconomic benefits:•the creation of value, through the generation of energy securities assets;•the gradual replacement of the energy matrix of the municipal administration by clean and renewable energy;•the neutralization of the carbon of salvador and  consequent qualification of the municipality to processes of issuance of green bonds, encouraged infrastructure debentures, national and international green certification programs and financing lines of specific programs of activities of environmental interest; e•the use of energy generated as a commodity in the implementation of programs to promote economic development and entrepreneurial activity (pmamc, 2020).

title: be circular platform
desc: the ser circular program, an initiative of the city's climate action plan, aims to stimulate the adoption of the principles of the circular economy and the generation of business in the area. the principles of circular economy include preserving and strengthening natural capital, optimizing the use of material resources, and maximizing system efficiency. circular economy concepts can help improve water and energy efficiency and waste management, as well as reduce unemployment and informality. with this, the circular ser program will create new opportunities for generating income and reducing the environmental impacts of production chains. the program will focus on low-income communities and assisting existing start-ups and businesses for the adoption of circular economy principles. the program will consist of an online platform, which will offer materials, workshops and seminars on the principles of the circular economy, as well as training through a bus and containers in vulnerable communities on the principles and skills of the circular economy. the online platform will contain useful information to raise awareness of circular models and to help companies apply the principles of the circular and sustainable economy to their products, services and use of materials. the program will help create businesses and green jobs in the city, developing circular economy hackathons in low-income neighborhoods and training and empowering the workforce in the principles of the circular economy. therefore, it will generate wealth for communities that have been left without income due to the covid-19 pandemic. in addition, the program will contribute to the development of a low-carbon economy, reducing waste generation and increasing the reuse of materials in the production chain. reducing waste generation will also help reduce the risk of flooding and landslides caused by improper waste disposal in informal settlements in the city. it will thus promote climate justice and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: belo horizonte, capital of sustainability and resilience of latin america
desc: signs for active transportation: the goal of the project is to create facilities, through visual and universal communication, so that people can get around on foot and pedal more efficiently, comfortably and agility through the streets of belo horizonte. through the implementation of specific signs and focused on who is walking and pedaling, the project aims to shorten the distances between specific points of the city to optimize the displacements of active transport in the city. initially, the project will be implemented in the city center.
title+desc: belo horizonte, capital of sustainability and resilience of latin america. signs for active transportation: the goal of the project is to create facilities, through visual and universal communication, so that people can get around on foot and pedal more efficiently, comfortably and agility through the streets of belo horizonte. through the implementation of specific signs and focused on who is walking and pedaling, the project aims to shorten the distances between specific points of the city to optimize the displacements of active transport in the city. initially, the project will be implemented in the city center.

title: solar schools
desc: the solar schools project is being developed under the compasso ufmg program, through a partnership established between the university and city of belo horizonte, with the objective of developing methods and solutions for municipal areas most vulnerable to climate change. the project aims to research the dynamics of electricity use in standard buildings of the municipal school system, propose actions to improve energy efficiency according to national regulations and prepare the installation in a solar photovoltaic generator interconnected to the electricity network of the local concessionaire. since september 2018, the solar schools project has been accelerated by the urban-leds ii project and, since the end of 2019, has been part of the leds lab initiative of this project, both funded by the european commission and implemented by iclei - local governments for sustainability in partnership with un-habitat. in this context, belo horizonte was selected to receive direct support from a consortium of specialized consultancies hired by iclei and composed by mitsidi projetos, i care & consult, markup consultores and hill consulting with the objective of implementing a pilot project of photovoltaic energy and/or energy efficiency from analysis of occupation and use of electricity at herbert josé de souza municipal school (emhjs),  in the northern region, as a first step towards the implementation of the solar schools project.recently, the leds lab consulting consortium concluded the series of webinars on climate finance, aimed at members. in addition, mitigation measures were proposed based on the analyses carried out by ufmg and the initiative's consultancy, which consider energy efficiency actions and renewable energy generation. two measures were selected for presenting technical, financial and environmental feasibility, with a view to implementing them in the emhj, i.e.: installation of photovoltaic solar power generation system (vf);  efficiency of internal lighting, considering the exchange of lamps and luminaires in order to meet the standards, improve visual comfort and save energy. these two mitigation measures will include the development of a basic project for each, that is, they will be studied, budgeted and detailed in order to effectively guide their implementation. part of these actions will be implemented with the seed capital made available by the urban-ledsii project (eur 15,000 or r$ 73,253.00), and part will be subject to application to obtain funding from other sources. recently, the consultancy submitted the solar schools project to the so-called par-procel, but it was not among the finalists. in the proposal presented, the total costs of the project were considered i.e., a scenario in which all energy efficiency measures were met and the photovoltaic solar power generation system was fully installed in the emhjs.  in addition, the replication of the project was considered in two new buildings of the municipal public school system. below, the total costs of the project and the costs of its replication are presented: total emhjs costs: r$675,000.00photovoltaic system: r$250,000lighting: r$130,000.00equipment change: r$60.00.00 000,00meters: r$10 000electric retrofit: r$200 000training: r$25 000replication in 2 buildings2 bh pilots (seed): r$134 0002 diagnostics: r$100 000

title: cycling infrastructure
desc: cycling infrastructure: implementation of 150 km of bike paths and bike paths (map here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0b3tqa2yarwrackxaekzxcwpkcfk/view) fully integrated to public transport. these 150 km are 36% of the planned cycle network in planmob-bh (sustainable urban mobility plan of belo horizonte) with a total of 410 km. the contribution of the typology of cycle projects was discussed with cyclists who produced a report with their issues for each street, and is the result of an agreement with civil society (cyclist) and public sector (municipality) that each cycle infrastructure needs to be discussed with civil society before implementation.
title+desc: cycling infrastructure. cycling infrastructure: implementation of 150 km of bike paths and bike paths (map here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0b3tqa2yarwrackxaekzxcwpkcfk/view) fully integrated to public transport. these 150 km are 36% of the planned cycle network in planmob-bh (sustainable urban mobility plan of belo horizonte) with a total of 410 km. the contribution of the typology of cycle projects was discussed with cyclists who produced a report with their issues for each street, and is the result of an agreement with civil society (cyclist) and public sector (municipality) that each cycle infrastructure needs to be discussed with civil society before implementation.

title: electric mobility
desc: this project is coordinated by bhtrans and accelerated, since september 2018, by the urban leds ii project (implemented by iclei - local governments for sustainability in partnership with un-habitat with funding from the european commission and executed in belo horizonte in partnership with the city hall, through the special projects management of the municipal environment secretariat),  being aimed at electrifying the public transport fleet of the capital. its vision is as follows: "by 2021, belo horizonte will have a fleet of at least 25 electric buses operating in its conventional service, with the aim of improving air quality, reducing noise pollution and reducing greenhouse gas emissions." to this end, technical, economic, commercial and political risks have been mapped and risk mitigation actions are being studied. the financing alternatives of vehicles or batteries (imported components of higher value) are also being studied, but are still a challenge to be overcome. the pilot project includes a fleet of vehicles consisting of 3 minibuses, 17 standard buses and 5 articulated buses. the minibuses will be allocated to the vilas and favelas system (villages and slums) and on lines that circulate on roads with restrictions on the operation of larger vehicles. they can also be allocated to the companion service. conventional and standard vehicles represent the vast majority of the municipal fleet, distributed in circular, diametric, radial and power lines. the use of articulated vehicles is concentrated in the trunk system and they travel through exclusive routes or with preferential treatment for public transport. the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, the improvement of air quality and the reduction of noise pollution are among the opportunities and impacts of the project, as well as the increase in the service of the public transport system, with the possibility of implementing this same technology in other areas. of the city.

in other areas. of the city.

title: mobility observatory
desc: urban mobility observatory (new website and tools): since 2013, belo horizonte has an urban mobility observatory, based on indicators to evaluate the results of the sustainable urban mobility plan of belo horizonte and a group of 64 stakeholders (including social movements, universities, technical associations, public institutions from other sectors, etc.). the current website (www.bhtrans.gov.br/observatorio) has some sections to disseminate information (library, indicator pages) and to stimulate discussion (critical opinions) about the problems and solutions of urban mobility. the content of this project is to improve this site with new tools such as a digital library with browser, factsheets on good practices, a platform to receive ideas from civil society based on maps and a digital edition of the urban mobility balance, an annual report with the result of key indicators. the group of indicators used by the observatory includes environmental issues such as global and local emissions, and is very useful for also assessing the effectiveness of pregee - greenhouse gas emission reduction plan.

title: municipal cycle plan
desc: the cycle plan will cover more than 180 km of bicycle paths in the various regions of the municipality and will be articulated with the main axes of transport. in total, campinas has already implemented more than 109 km of cycle routes (bike paths, cycle lanes, cycle lanes and shared sidewalks). to expand the supply of bike lanes and cycle lanes, the city plans to significantly increase the length of these bike lanes and cycle lanes in the coming years. the implementation of bicycle paths will have private funding, through environmental compensation. in 2016, two bike paths were implemented (on baden powel and north-south avenues) and at least 30 km in executive projects are being funded by the municipal environment fund.http://www.emdec.com.br/eficiente/sites/portalemdec/en-br/site.php?secao=sistema-cicloviario&pub=17650

title: linear parks
desc: the municipal legislation provides for the implementation and consolidation of forty-nine linear parks in the city. the municipality intends to finance the development of basic projects, which will allow the implementation of priority stretches defined through environmental compensation or other financing strategies, mainly in partnership with private initiative and national and international funds. the linear parks implementation program was awarded the tap iclei seal and selected for the gap fund project. in addition, to present two approved linear parks, 6 executive projects prepared and 16 basic projects by the private sector in the process of land parceling.https://www.campinas.sp.gov.br/governo/ambiente/parques-linears.php
title+desc: linear parks. the municipal legislation provides for the implementation and consolidation of forty-nine linear parks in the city. the municipality intends to finance the development of basic projects, which will allow the implementation of priority stretches defined through environmental compensation or other financing strategies, mainly in partnership with private initiative and national and international funds. the linear parks implementation program was awarded the tap iclei seal and selected for the gap fund project. in addition, to present two approved linear parks, 6 executive projects prepared and 16 basic projects by the private sector in the process of land parceling.https://www.campinas.sp.gov.br/governo/ambiente/parques-linears.php

title: inter 2 hotline capacity and speed increase
desc: the project foresees physical and operational interventions in the 38 kilometers long by direction, of a set of roads that make up the ring road of the direct line. road requalification works, implementation of exclusive lanes for public transport, sharing of channel segments, reform and reconstruction of transport terminals, expansion and relocation of tube stations, geometric changes in saturated crossings, trench construction, implementation of new traffic binaries, semaphoric prioritization, monitoring and electronic surveillance of exclusive lanes will be carried out. the "inter 2" hotline consists of a radial line of "ligeirinho" , which has few stops, in tube stations or terminals. it has great importance for the city's transport system because it makes the connection between the five structural axes (transport corridors with exclusive channels). it was implemented as an alternative to the interbairros ii paradora line, the main responsible for the effective integration of users of public transportation, as it provides the possibility of exchanges of displacement between the main axes, in addition to trunk roads, associated with the city's development master plan. thus, the integration is carried out through the terminals and tube stations of the various axes, without going through the center of curitiba.considering the importance of the inter line 2 as a promoter of the integration between the transport axes, it is essential to invest in increasing its capacity, thus allowing support to the growth of the system demand and the optimization of rit - integrated transport network.today,  the inter 2 line carries just over 80,000 passengers/business day, with intervals (frequency) of approximately 21/2 minutes (clockwise) and approximately 31/2 minutes (counterclockwise), with an average speed of 22.30 km/h, totaling 102 minutes to complete the circuit. the quality indicator of the inter 2 line, although interventions have been carried out to improve its performance, is at the top of the complaints ranking. in addition to new users wanting to use it, current users complain about their irregularity caused by the retention and comboiamento of buses, due to this circular line in shared traffic, repeatedly saturated in various locations at peak times. in 2010, the line had its programming changed, reducing the operating speed from approximately 25 km/h to approximately 22 km/h in an attempt to maintain its regularity, which, despite this, remains compromised. the main expected benefits with the implementation of the project are:improvement of travel times due to the increase in the operational speed of buses, for an important portion of the demand of the integrated transport network - rit; improvement in the operation of buses in terminals and tube stations; environmental gains by replacing fuel in the new operating fleet of articulated buses, 30 vehicles on the inter 2 line and 10 vehicles on the interbairros line ii; e,gains for all components of mobility, due to the interventions provided for in the road system and equipment, implemented along the 38 km of extension per direction. to improve the operational speed of buses will be necessary physical works on the roads that make up your itinerary, the installation of equipment (priority traffic lights, electronic inspection of exclusive lanes, monitoring cameras), and complete fleet of articulated buses powered by biofuel, and new tube stations.as complementary works, will be redone sidewalks and cycle facilities, drainage and public lighting.

title: complementation of the green line in the city of curitiba - northern green line and green line - south extension
desc: the green line project has a total of five lanes, arranged longitudinally to the old domain strip of the br-116 highway, in an extension of approximately 22 km. the project foresees the construction of new runways, with stretches of use of existing lanes. they are: the central channel, exclusive to public transport, marginal roads and local roads, left and right. the project will also include bike paths and walking tours. in this way, the green line will result in a high-performance, multimodal route, both in terms of traffic capacity and security for its users. the projected lanes have the purpose of meeting the demand of the new transport corridor safely, through a set of lanes dedicated to each modal, and predicted traffic characteristics, with the components listed below:exclusive channel: the channel is the central lane, exclusive to the express lines of public transport type brt, where will travel bi-articulated buses. marginal roads: the two side lanes to the exclusive channel, intended for the circulation of vehicles in general that today use the highway. the marginal roads will be separated from the local roads, located on the outerside of the set of lanes, by variable-width beds with specific landscaping. local roads: local roads, formerly called marginal roads of the br-116 highway, will be implemented and/or adapted at the limit of the highway's domain lane, serving as access to the beautiful activities. they will feature longitudinal parking lane, and one-way traffic lane. along the extensions of future brt passenger boarding and disembarking stations, local roads will be superimposed on marginal roads. after the season, the slopes return to their normal composition. public transport stations: the stations along the green line were provided with the function of allowing the integration of the lines that will use it, with the other public transport lines, existing or planned, that will cross the green line.the project is a new inducer of development of the city, through land use and zoning changes,  allowing the increase of socioeconomic activities and urban and environmental revitalization. in the neighborhoods beautiful to the axis resides about 32% of the population of curitiba.

title: curitiba mais energia - photovoltaic panels in the bus station and in 3 public transport terminals
desc: the “curitiba mais energia” project has as its scope the installation of photovoltaic systems (pv) connected to the grid on the roofs of four bus terminals and on the ground over a closed sanitary landfill. the total power of the facilities is estimated between 10 and 15 mw, and will contribute to the reduction of 89,028 tons of co2 between 2020 and 2050 in the emission of greenhouse gases by the city. the project will be implemented following the energy compensation mechanism, net metering, regulated by aneel resolution n°482/2012 for distributed generation (dg). the plant to be installed in the landfill will be built in partnership with copel (an energy concessionaire in paraná), through the formation of an spe. the business model for the implementation of the plants on the roofs is under study.

title: tree on my causeway
desc: project that carries out planting of semi-adult tree seedlings for requesting citizens who commit to adopt them for 2 years. it assists in increasing vegetation cover, encourages shared responsibility between citizens and the public authorities in caring for the environment and the adoption of preservationist habits by citizens. it aims to strengthen the program to carry out more care and capture users around urban parks, conservation units and other environmental projects.

title: solar trees
desc: solar trees consist of equipment that captures solar energy and transforms it into electric energy. the project aims to: popularize the use of renewable energies for users of urban parks; provide power to electric vehicle supply points (electropostos); and provide clean energy in public equipment. 10 solar trees will be deployed in public equipment by 2025, urban parks and health equipment, directly benefiting 225,643,000 fortified.

title: composting centers
desc: installation of composting stations in institutions that work community gardens or urban agriculture. it aims to encourage local alternatives for the reuse of organic waste with the participation of the population. by 2025, 200 workshops will be held to establish the pilots installation of 10 final composting plants

title: implementation of spaces recycling attitudes and collectors pev's.
desc: it integrates the articulation, mobilization, sensitization and implementation of collecting islands for voluntary delivery of recyclables in schools of the municipal school network. the collected materials are given to waste pickers or associations of community waste pickers in the surrounding area. the main partners are municipal department of conservation and public services (scsp), ecofor ambiental and socicam. the schools of the municipal school network, in fortaleza, which have already benefited from the pev's project.

title: afforestation plan
desc: instrument for planning afforestation actions in the city of fortaleza, which encourages, in an orderly and systematized manner, the plantations in fortaleza, with goals established for short, medium and long term. the afforestation plan seeks to increase the green coverage of the city, through tree planting and seedling donations by the department of urbanism and environment. the afforestation plan has several aspects of operation, with 6 main projects highlighted: tree on my causeway; a child, a tree; donations of seedlings in the leisure cycle track; recycling attitudes in schools; donations of seedlings in seuma; and exchange of seedlings for recyclables.

title: fortaleza municipal plan for walkability - pmcfor.
desc: the municipal plan of walkability of fortaleza (pmcfor), which aims to encourage the displacement of pedestrians and people with reduced mobility on sidewalks, through the requalification of sidewalks, ensuring completeness in neighborhoods, relating housing and work. it has the mission of diagnosing the situation of sidewalks in the city and reflecting on strategies and guidelines of actions that can guide the executive power regarding public policies that envision walkability and, in the broader sense, human mobility, as a central or transversal theme.

title: recycling attitudes in the city
desc: recycling attitudes in the city - the project seeks to requalify irregular garbage disposal points in the city, with the cleaning of the site, landscape improvements and environmental education actions with the community. the recycling attitudes program is a bet of changing attitudes of the citizen towards the city. a proposal for cultural change. it proposes a new way of relationship of the citizen with fortaleza, with its potentialities and its challenges. environmental education is the main tool, but it is not the only one, for the implementation of sustainable actions and new attitudes in the process of building a sustainable, shared and kind fortress

title: av. tatters
desc: one of the degraded areas of the capital, avenida farrapos should come to life again if it depends on a project of the city. porto alegre was chosen, among other cities in latin america, by the spanish agency for international development cooperation to receive an investment of r$ 1.3 million. the amount has been released to lost background, that is, it will not need to be returned. the idea is to use it to delimit exactly what needs to be done on the road and what the costs of these improvements are - from there, the city will seek other resources to carry out the work, which will go from the conceição viaduct to rua teodora, in a 4.7-kilometer stretch. repairs will be made on asphalt and paving, landscaping and revitalization of construction sites and squares. the bus corridor — a yellow concrete mureta present in much of the avenue — will be knocked down and replaced by other alternatives that are still being studied, such as an exclusive bus lane.

title: public concessions
desc: the current management focuses on concessions and ppps to deliver better services to the population. in addition to the public lighting ppp, which provides for the modernization of 100% of the network with led lamps in the next 2 years, porto alegrenses also recovered the feeling of belonging to the city with the rapprochement to the shores of lake guaíba. in june 2018, the urban park of orla moacyr scliar was delivered and, in 2021, the works were completed in section 3, which comprises the mouth of the arroio flood, until the beginning of the giant park. suspended due to the pandemic, the notice for concession, for 35 years, of section 2 will be relaunched soon. the area comprises 134,400 square meters and 850 meters long, plus a strip of water, which runs from the cuias kneecap to the sunset amphitheater. the results of the authorization applications, approved in december 2021, have already been disclosed. two companies were authorized to develop technical and economic-financial studies for the implementation of a new anchor element, the marina da orla.no beginning of 2021, was signed the concession of stretch 1 of the orla, which includes the harmonia park and has as one of the basic premises the preservation of green areas and the realization of sustainable projects. the initial project developed for harmonia park provides for the receipt of r$ 31 million in investments and the generation of approximately 500 jobs. the concession notice indicates that the architecture of the buildings should be thought of with sustainable premises, with minimal intervention to the environment and landscape. the notice also provides for awareness-raising campaigns to stimulate the preservation of natural environments and reduce the volume of waste produced. also in progress is the process of granting the public market of porto alegre, the structuring of the concession for the universalization of basic sanitation, among other opportunities for partnerships already executed (such as those of street clocks, street signs and the auditorium araujo vianna) or in the process of homologation (such as the victoria animal health unit).

title: light of knowledge
desc: implementing an energy efficiency project in the 99 schools of the municipal school system and expanding the project to other public buildings in the municipality is what the luz do saber project predicts. felicity / giz made available, free of charge to the city, through a cooperation agreement, specialized technical consultancy for the construction of the project. the initiative is part of the administration's structuring programs, and provides for the installation of panels to capture sunlight, led lamps and other initiatives that will generate savings in the light bill and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. more details about the project will be released by the municipality in due course.

title: urban terrarians: transfer of small idle public areas into sustainable pocketparks
desc: transform idle public areas of up to 500 m² into sustainable spaces of leisure, coexistence and contact with nature. this is what provides for decree 20.652/2020, which establishes urban terrários and stimulates the activation of residual public areas with services and commerce. inspired by new york's mini-parks model, the goal of the project is to transform unused areas with low commercial value into places that attract the population. the project results from the partnership between the government and the alegre pact (ufrgs, pucrs, unisinos, society and private initiative) to make the capital of the state of peru a reference in innovation and quality of life. porto alegre has about 300 waste areas idle owned by the city. because they are not being used, these spaces are often invaded or used for irregular waste disposal. like the parklets of porto alegre, the intention is to resignify the relationship of people with the city and encourage entrepreneurship and the generation of employment and income from the launch of notices for the activation of these areas, creating a new option for the qualification of the urban landscape, meeting the principles of sustainability the public power will allow the use of space,  which will be freely accessible to the population. on the other hand, the permissionary will bear the costs of maintaining the space, which will be vitalized by him. the urban terrário is composed of open and enclosed space and can have a total area of up to 500 m². the projects should include sustainability measures, using building materials, urban furniture and other equipment manufactured with ecological materials; planting of native flora of the state; rational use of water through efficient irrigation systems or reuse; use of alternative forms of energy; measures aimed at reducing the formation of heat islands, such as green walls and roofs and the use of alternative forms of drainage, such as rain gardens. in addition to contributing to prevent soil waterproofing, contributing to the drainage system, terrários can also contribute to increased urban security, as they stimulate the flow of people in areas without use. the pilot project of urban terrários in the onerous tpu modality was the object of bidding in 2021, after the publication of decree 20.652/2020. in this case, the possibility of commercial exploitation or services of activities active by the missionary is provided for, as a counterpart for the implementation. the expected completion of the pilot implementation on the ground located on avenida cel. lucas de oliveira (1,831), is scheduled for 2022.

title: recife energy efficiency city project
desc: solar energy in municipal buildings taking into account the actions foreseen in the ghg emission reduction plan of recife, the solar energy project for the equipment of the city of recife aims to install photovoltaic panels, generating 28,251 mwh annually for the supply of municipal public institutions and reduce the impacts of ghgs by 7,789.18 tco2e. with the installations of these panels, the city hall will produce energy for public institutions, but also, will promote environmental education from the visibility of solar panels throughout the city, setting an example to the population in a sustainable way to generate their energy. in this scope, it is also up to the articulation with other public and private spheres to establish goals and incentives to stimulate the use of clean energy by the population. in order to ensure the execution of the project and its financial viability, the installations of photovoltaic panels were divided into modules, prioritizing the action in the pcr's home building, in the municipal schools and day care centers, in the academies of the city and, finally, in the upinhas and family health units. if executed, this project will generate an annual savings of r$ 17,424,000.00 to municipal coffers from the sixth year of its application. thus, by 2037, when recife turns 500, the municipality will have stopped spending r$ 268,360,000.00 on energy bills.

title: smart culverts
desc: smart manholesthe daily production of garbage is a major problem for large brazilian cities. although the collection system has undergone considerable improvements in recent years, such as selective collection, for example, it is often inefficient. the result of this is the frequent accumulation of non-degradable waste in inappropriate places, such as manholes and wolf mouths. clogging the flow routes reduces the flow of rainwater, causing flooding. when they do not stop at the service stations (culverts), which are part of the city's sewage network, this garbage is destined to streams and rivers, polluting them and facilitating the overflow of their waters in times of flooding. although part of this pollution is due to irregular sewage routes and not all sewage treatment, street waste is also largely responsible for the degradation of streams and rivers. polluted rivers and floods cause disturbances to the population and traffic, compromising real estate and even loss of life. recife has about 1500 km of network of galleries and channels that make up the drainage system of the municipality. because it is a city that is practically at sea level, and because it already experiences some effects from climate change, recife suffers from the incidence of flooding in specific posts. when it rains, the situation tends to get worse in these places. an action of cleaning galleries and channels recently carried out by the city hall in a single street of a neighborhood of the city showed that in just one day of operation, 45 tons of waste were removed. thus, it is desirable to apply measures that prevent this waste from reaching the city's drainage network. known as "smart culverts", the technology offers an efficient solution for solving this problem. it is a filter that is placed in the culverts of the city, presenting itself as physical barriers and preventing the waste from seeping. coupled to this mechanism, sensors are installed that indicate the volume of garbage retained in the filter. this information is accompanied by the city's urban cleaning company through an application/software, which sends a responsible team to empty the filter. this technology ensures faster cleaning of the culverts, as workers are able to complete the service in 5 to 10 minutes, while the traditional cleaning method lasts from 40 to 50 minutes. this fact entails more culverts being cleaned in a shorter space of time in the city, leading to a reduction in public spending. in addition, due to the nature of the waste that ends up in the channels and culverts being plastic objects, these materials can be sent for their due recycling. allied to these actions, the city hall should carry out awareness and environmental education activities for the population in order to reduce, mainly, the habit of throwing garbage on the streets. for this project, we aim to apply this technology in a neighborhood of the city of recife, totaling 213 culverts.
title+desc: smart culverts. smart manholesthe daily production of garbage is a major problem for large brazilian cities. although the collection system has undergone considerable improvements in recent years, such as selective collection, for example, it is often inefficient. the result of this is the frequent accumulation of non-degradable waste in inappropriate places, such as manholes and wolf mouths. clogging the flow routes reduces the flow of rainwater, causing flooding. when they do not stop at the service stations (culverts), which are part of the city's sewage network, this garbage is destined to streams and rivers, polluting them and facilitating the overflow of their waters in times of flooding. although part of this pollution is due to irregular sewage routes and not all sewage treatment, street waste is also largely responsible for the degradation of streams and rivers. polluted rivers and floods cause disturbances to the population and traffic, compromising real estate and even loss of life. recife has about 1500 km of network of galleries and channels that make up the drainage system of the municipality. because it is a city that is practically at sea level, and because it already experiences some effects from climate change, recife suffers from the incidence of flooding in specific posts. when it rains, the situation tends to get worse in these places. an action of cleaning galleries and channels recently carried out by the city hall in a single street of a neighborhood of the city showed that in just one day of operation, 45 tons of waste were removed. thus, it is desirable to apply measures that prevent this waste from reaching the city's drainage network. known as "smart culverts", the technology offers an efficient solution for solving this problem. it is a filter that is placed in the culverts of the city, presenting itself as physical barriers and preventing the waste from seeping. coupled to this mechanism, sensors are installed that indicate the volume of garbage retained in the filter. this information is accompanied by the city's urban cleaning company through an application/software, which sends a responsible team to empty the filter. this technology ensures faster cleaning of the culverts, as workers are able to complete the service in 5 to 10 minutes, while the traditional cleaning method lasts from 40 to 50 minutes. this fact entails more culverts being cleaned in a shorter space of time in the city, leading to a reduction in public spending. in addition, due to the nature of the waste that ends up in the channels and culverts being plastic objects, these materials can be sent for their due recycling. allied to these actions, the city hall should carry out awareness and environmental education activities for the population in order to reduce, mainly, the habit of throwing garbage on the streets. for this project, we aim to apply this technology in a neighborhood of the city of recife, totaling 213 culverts.

title: cycletracks for climate
desc: cycle tracks for climatethe main objective of the project is to increase the city of recife with an efficient cycle system that meets the cycle forward master plan of the metropolitan region of recife and the ghg reduction plan of recife (low carbon plan), with actions that provide for the implementation of wooded bicycle paths. for this reason, the city's structuring cycling roads will be prioritized, ensuring the afforestation of these and, in this way, reducing the heat islands and ghg emissions of the municipality. this action will ensure the implementation of 100% of the complementary cycle network provided for in the cycle plan and 100% of the low carbon plan target, ensuring that 22,220 tco2e is no longer issued due to the implemented bike paths and 550 tco2e due to afforestation, totaling 22,770 tco2e of mitigation annually.

title: eco recife program - management and sustainable use of water in the city hall headquarters building
desc: filter gardens: the problem of sanitation and protection of rivers has a complex nature and throughout history the city has not yet been able to endear them to the extent necessary to reverse the scenario of degradation. therefore, it is essential to add efforts and make use of innovative strategies of action. based on this perspective, some water cleaning and treatment technologies were researched and discussed as complementary alternatives to basic sanitation. among the alternatives researched, the technology called filter gardens was identified as appropriate for this context. this technology presents some characteristics considered important for its application in the city. among them, the relatively simple and low-cost management of systems; the possibility of water treatment systems being inserted as aquatic gardens with landscape qualities; the use and protection of riverside areas as public areas of environmental recovery, avoiding future occupations and environmental risks; and the significantly lower greenhouse gas (ghg) emission level than other conventional sewage treatment systems. in the context of recife, what is proposed is to use filter garden systems in some stretches of polluted streams, but which still has great potential to recover its environmental qualities, and to become leisure areas for the population. the sections were selected according to the characteristics of the existing streams and their surroundings (type of urban occupation, topography, water flow, etc.), as well as the observed potential to assume role as exemplary interventions for a new pattern of urban action in urban streams of recife. that is, to establish a paradigm shift in the city. in objective terms, the main guideline to be considered here is the rupture with the still dominant concept that promoted the rectification and waterproofing of much of recife's streams as the main way to protect urbanized areas from floods and floods.  thus, the four areas selected for installation of filter gardens comprise the region of capibaribe park and jiquiá park, offering improvement of the waters on the capibaribe river, and the jiquiá and tejipió rivers.

title: restructuring and expansion of the forest nursery of the botanical garden of recife
desc: restructuring and expansion of the forest nursery of the botanical garden of recife: a nursery is a structured space, with its own characteristics, where there is the production, management and protection of seedlings, until they are old and large enough to resist in real field conditions. they are environments whose facilities recreate the similar conditions that nature offers for the seeds to germin, until they are ready to endure travel, planting or recreating it, in the places where they will live permanently. whatever its function, every nursery makes possible the urban afforestation of cities, the re-cupeção of degraded areas, research, and the creation of an ecological and critical awareness about the environment in which we live. in the botanical garden of recife, the forest nursery produces mainly seedlings of native species aimed at the urban afforestation of the city. however, a diagnosis of the current situation identified problems in the functioning of the nursery, impairing the production of seedlings and the quality of the service offered. among these problems, one can highlight as the most significant: 1. restricted production area; 2. insufficient number of field personnel; 3. manual irrigation; 4. absence of qualified personnel to collect seeds, generating a reduction in the quality and quantity of seeds and species used; 5. physical disorganization, generating misuse of the area and, consequently, decrease in the supply of seedlings; 6. absence of own vehicle and resources for insums, causing discontinuity of services and leading to non-compliance with planning. based on this diagnosis, it was verified the real need for an action plan that aims to expand and restructure the forest nursery of the botanical garden of recife so that it can efficiently respond to the various purposes imposed by the institution and the environment secretariat of the city of recife.objectives:- produce 42,000 seedlings of native species of the atlantic forest annually,  aiming to meet the needs of the urban afforestation plan of the city of recife;- use the structure of the forest nursery as an ecopedagogical strategy for visitors to the botanical garden of recife, providing dissemination of knowledge about the uses and importance of atlantic forest species reproduced in the forest nursery;- produce scientific knowledge through germination experiments and development of atlantic forest species,  those included in the list of endangered species.

title: selective collection project - expansion
desc: because it is classified as the 12th most populous city in the state of são paulo, são josé do rio preto faces one of the serious problems common to all municipalities, which concerns the recyclable materials discarded every day with the collected waste. each inhabitant produces on average approximately 0.920 kilos of waste per day. approximately 30% of the total is recovered by the company that performs the collection and sorting, being 12% equivalent to organic material transformed into organic compound and 18% recyclable materials. the municipality decided to seek alternative ways to achieve a significant increase in the recovery of materials that were dispensed in the common waste, having the present selective collection action, focus on dissemination and training of techniques of good sustainable practices, being a continuous action, which seeks each year to develop improvements in the action, improving what is already implemented. in view of the need of the municipality to increase the collection rate of recyclable materials, the selective collection was implemented being carried out by two waste pickers: cooperlagos - social cooperative of selective collection, processing and transformation of recyclable materials; and ares - riopretense association of education and health.the main objective of the program is to promote awareness of selective collection in the population, integrating the work of the cooperative cooperlagos and the ares association, which together guide residents on the correct storage of these materials. the actions are developed by the municipal department of environment and urbanism and municipal labor department, in partnership with the departments of health and social assistance. these secretariats are part of the municipal selective collection program of the municipality of são josé do rio preto, which has a technical staff of the departments of labor and environment, which define the collection areas. the health department also participates in the process of orientation and awareness of the population through community health agents, which has increased the participation of citizens to the program due to the bond between them. another assignment is to participate in the technical coordination of selective collection, assisting in the delimitation of the collection basins, in line with the areas of coverage of health units.the secretariat of social assistance has a very important role in the inclusion of cooperative members and associates through indications of the social assistance network and forwarded by the entities to special care and families in a situation of vulnerability. this selective collection work serves approximately 30% of the municipality area and, in relation to the total municipal solid waste collected, ranges from 1% to 2%, evolving over the years. approximately 95% of the materials collected by the associations are marketed for recycling. the remaining 5% that make up the tailings, are destined to the landfill that meets the urban cleaning of the municipality, belonging to third parties. citizens can consult information and explanations, through the link https://www.riopreto.sp.gov.br/meio environment / where you will find the option "selective collection". for the expansion of the project, aiming at the service of the entire municipality with selective collection, there is the need to purchase 10 trucks 3/4 with open body dry load, wood / steel with minimum length of 6 (six) meters, equipped with cage, total gross weight minimum 8,500kg, maximum minimum traction capacity 11,000 kg.*the values presented have as reference budgets received in august 2021 during the purchase process.

title: expansion of the drainage and sewage network of the municipality
desc: the state through its concessionaire has been expanding the sewage network of the municipality of aracaju. the municipality has also been working on the expansion of its drainage network and stormwater runoff.

title: alto araguaia basin revitalization program - pilot project municipality of barra do garças/mt
desc: the program for revitalization of the alto araguaia tributary basin has as its general objective to combat the process of degradation of natural resources by increasing water supply and water quality, initially through the development of a pilot project to revitalize a sub-basin in the municipality of barra do garças-mt. then, in possession of this result and experience, a feasible and replicable plan will be presented to the other municipalities of the basin.thus the program proposes a reference methodology of diagnosis from the survey of critical areas indicated for the environmental recovery of the upper araguaia basin on a semi-detailed scale. in the municipality of barra do garças/mt, the diagnosis will be carried out on a detailed scale, for the most reliable location and characterization of these environments that need intervention/restoration process leading to the choice of the pilot sub-basin. the partnerships will take place through a voluntary agreement, i.e. family farmers who will receive the investments will commit to using techniques and sustainable pasture management for which they will be trained. during the execution of the pilot project, the results obtained will be disclosed to the degraded dbacias farmers of other municipalities of the upper araguaia basin, promoting the discussion for replication of these experiences, making the activity, in addition to being environmentally sustainable, economically attractive and financially feasible.

title: paradise of the waters program
desc: the paradise of water program is structured by the municipal tourism department based on the municipal tourism plan, focusing on the strategic axis of planning and managing tourism with the objectives of creating and strengthening new products and tourism services of the private initiative. in 2018, rural owners who have natural attractions of tourist potential were gathered in their properties, in order to identify the difficulties for implementing a tourist product. in 2019, the araguaia tourism forum was held where the program's outline was presented to the target audience. there was a broad acceptance that led to the creation of the paradise of waters program by municipal decree no. 4,197 of september 23, 2019. the program consists of 12 steps, summarized in: mapping, formalization, tourist diagnosis, safety diagnosis and prevention, environmental licensing, architectural and engineering design, planning, financing (if necessary), implementation, training, promotion and monitoring.

title: horta municipal - cultivating health and knowledge project
desc: the project was prepared by the department of agriculture in partnership with the departments of education and health, with the aim of establishing in the largest municipal school a public space, that is, a vegetable garden in the school for the production of fruits, vegetables, vegetables and herbs medicines that could be used in the lunch of the entire municipal school system. in this environment, in addition to being produced food with quality and free of pesticides, it is used by all teachers of the teaching network as a teaching environment, since students have contact with food production and through this are led to learn subjects such as science, portuguese, mathematics and etc. in addition, with the participation of the nutritionist of the education network, every menu is adapted and based on the needs of students and vegetables, vegetables and fruits are produced according to the need and the time of year. moreover, when the surplus of production is produced, food is destined to families in situations of social vulnerability.

title: solar energy
desc: currently, the energy expenses of the municipality of campo grande are close to 18 million reais. in order to reduce costs and use clean energy for the performance of its activities, the city began a study to evaluate the feasibility of implanting a photovoltaic park. the project is in the process of surveying the consumption of the 564 consumer units of the city to prepare a preliminary technical study.

title: sustainable cordeirópolis
desc: the municipality of cordeirópolis, seeks alternatives for the supply of electricity aiming at reducing the commitment of public resources with expenses of this nature, and expanding actions in search of environmental sustainability, reinforcing the policy of commitment to the environment of public administration.

title: water conservator
desc: the conservative water project, created by municipal law no. 2,100/2005, consists of carrying out the planimetric survey of rural properties, indicating their current situation and what will be the proposed goals for the site. the municipal department of environment is responsible for developing such projects defining the actions that should be implemented and the goals to be achieved, depending on the characteristics of the property. the main objectives are: (1) to promote municipal actions to support the social, economic and environmental sustainability of the management and practices implemented, through financial incentives to owners funded by payment for environmental services (psa); (2) reduce the levels of diffuse rural pollution due to sedimentation and eutrophication processes and lack of environmental sanitation; (3) disseminate the concept of integrated forest, soil and water management in the jaguari river hydrographic basin; and (4) increase forest cover in river sub-basins and implement ecological microcorridors. the expertise accumulated with the project since 2005 allowed the advance of environmental adequacy actions of rural properties for the implementation of a municipal system of conservation units - smuc, maintaining the psa as an economic instrument to achieve the goal. municipal decree no. 2,887/2015 establishes environmental conservation areas as priorities for the creation of conservation units (uc), corresponding to 8,125 hectares, 33% of the area of the municipality of extrema. the proposal is to transform these areas into a mosaic of uc, consisting of private reserves of natural heritage (rppn) with psa and the municipal natural park (pnm).

title: extreme no climate
desc: the extreme climate programme was conceived in 2018, including the conservative water project. in addition to contributing to the carbon fixation in the search for neutral climate, the initiative contributes to an increase in the quantity and quality of water resources that supply not only extreme, but also the cantareira system, responsible for supplying the metropolitan region of são paulo, the largest city in south america and which experienced the worst water crisis during 2014 and 2015.com the creation of the climate change policy,  extrema carried out the approximation of the commercial and industrial sectors to the initiatives of forest restoration and carbon fixation carried out by the government. thus, in 2018 the program began the implementation of the incorporation of the impacts of greenhouse gas emissions in the municipal environmental licensing processes of potentially polluting enterprises and activities, through environmental compensation linked to the municipal fund for payment for environmental services (fmpsa), aimed at forest restoration and neutralization of carbon emissions. to date, the program has the support of 178 companies, from the industrial and trade sectors, with the total neutralization of 17.4% of their emissions, referring to the period 2017 to 2021, which represents 140,292 hectares of forest restoration. regarding the base year 2021, 11,877,595 tco2e were compensated, and 37,118 hectares were restored with the planting of native vegetation of the atlantic forest biome.
title+desc: extreme no climate. the extreme climate programme was conceived in 2018, including the conservative water project. in addition to contributing to the carbon fixation in the search for neutral climate, the initiative contributes to an increase in the quantity and quality of water resources that supply not only extreme, but also the cantareira system, responsible for supplying the metropolitan region of são paulo, the largest city in south america and which experienced the worst water crisis during 2014 and 2015.com the creation of the climate change policy,  extrema carried out the approximation of the commercial and industrial sectors to the initiatives of forest restoration and carbon fixation carried out by the government. thus, in 2018 the program began the implementation of the incorporation of the impacts of greenhouse gas emissions in the municipal environmental licensing processes of potentially polluting enterprises and activities, through environmental compensation linked to the municipal fund for payment for environmental services (fmpsa), aimed at forest restoration and neutralization of carbon emissions. to date, the program has the support of 178 companies, from the industrial and trade sectors, with the total neutralization of 17.4% of their emissions, referring to the period 2017 to 2021, which represents 140,292 hectares of forest restoration. regarding the base year 2021, 11,877,595 tco2e were compensated, and 37,118 hectares were restored with the planting of native vegetation of the atlantic forest biome.

title: thermochemical power plant - utge extrema
desc: with the proximity of the closure of the life of the municipal landfill, the municipality of extrema is in the transition phase to a new solution for the disposal of municipal solid waste, cleaner and efficient, which envisions the energy use of waste, through a thermochemical power plant (utge), for gasification of waste and conversion into electricity. the plant will be powered by waste derived fuel (cdr). the main advantages of utge are the reduction of the need for a final waste disposal area (in relation to a landfill), the elimination of risks of environmental contamination of soil, water and air, the energy use of waste, with the generation of an economic asset, in addition to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions,  contributing to the municipal policy to combat changes climáticas.as works of the first phase of the plant, referring to the earthworks and construction of the shed of the waste-derived fuel processing line (cdr), were completed in 2021. the second phase will be the acquisition and installation of cdr line equipment, followed by the installation of the aerator and electrical generation facilities, through a public-private partnership.

title: selective collection in the urban zone of the municipality of itapipoca
desc: city hall, through the institute of environment of the municipality of itapipoca - immi, see carrying out several projects related to the management and management of solid waste in the municipality, such as:1. selective collection at the school – a partnership was made with e.e.b.sebastião malaquias do santos, in the locality of tabocal, with the objective of creating environmental awareness in the students. in this project, immi installed collectors in the school in question, held a lecture on environmental education and received the waste from it in its screening center, having used only own resources for this. the project started on november 21, 2018 and has a 2-year term.2. soap production workshops – immi, in partnership with large generators of residual vegetable oils and fats, collects this matter, preventing it from contaminating the environment, and conducting soap production workshops in communities of the municipality. this project started in october 2017 and has no date to finalize. the resources used in the actions are the institute's own resources.3. selective collection as a promotion for the living pharmacy program – also carried out by this institute the collection and disposal of recyclable waste of large generators, as well as the disposal of organic waste to compost, and beneficiation of the medicinal seedling beds present in the pharmacy viva doimmi. the resources used in the actions are the institute's own resources. the project started in 2017 and has no date to close, its partnership terms have validity of 01 year.4. pallet reuse program - through partnerships with commercial establishments of the municipality, the project aims to reuse the wood present in pallets for the protection of seedlings recently planted in the city, through the production of grids, in order to minimize the environmental impacts caused by the improper disposal of these materials and encourage sustainable actions in the municipality. the project started in april 2018 and is ongoing. the resources used for this purpose are own.

title: urban drainage
desc: urban drainage is an umbrella project that encompasses (sub) projects that articulate with each other, having:a. reservoir construction projects;b. bridge expansion projects; ec. projects to review structures and constructions of new verters. the growth of urbanization without proper planning results in changes in hydrological processes, such as increased surface runoff and decreased natural capacity for soil retention and infiltration (doubleday et al., 2013; marchioni; becciu, 2014; elga et al., 2015). this causes several social and environmental impacts, such as the increase in the frequency of floods and the reduction of water availability, because of water contamination (vargas, 1999). these problems result from decentralized actions in the basin and therefore should also be addressed on this scale. ahiablame et al. (2012) point to a growing concern to treat the problem near the source of the flows, in order to reduce and delay the peaks of the flood and also to allow the recharge of the groundwater. in the search to restore the flow conditions as close as possible to the existing before urbanization, compensatory techniques in urban drainage have gained importance. such techniques can be considered more environmentally appropriate urban solutions for rainwater management in urbanized areas aimed at reducing the impact of increased waterproofing on flood hydrograms (roy et al., 2008).

title: water availability for reuse
desc: this is a large and continuous project for "non-human" consumption of reuse water, coming from sewage treatment plants (ete) for internal cleaning and irrigation of gardens, in addition to municipal squares and gardens; availability to the municipality for use in works, in addition to cleaning streets and etc. annual estimate of 13,200,000 (thirteen million and two hundred thousand) liters of reuse water, consumed in place of the drinking water that is preserved. the project has no direct cost to the concessionaire.

title: water of valor program
desc: this is a broad and continuous program that aims to reduce the loss of drinking water in all stages of distribution carried out by the concessionaire, through the adoption of procedures, professional training, high investment in new technologies, highlighting the implementation of the operational control center (cco), sectorization of supply with the creation of the measurement and control districts (dmc),  automation and re-registration. average annual investment estimated at r$ 3,500,000.00 (snis).
