title: collective program
desc: it is a broad and continuous awareness program for sustainable consumption of material and immaterial resources, carried out for internal employees, outsourced and partners, through the distribution of educational material, awareness campaigns and etc. 3r training (reduce / reuse / recycle), providing in the units the necessary structures for selective collection of the "dry and wet" residue; reuse, recycling and/or appropriate final treatment.

title: energy efficiency program
desc: hydroenergetic studies have found that simply changing the operating regime of the motor pumps would greatly reduce the energy consumption of the operating units, which occurred with the implementation of this program. in addition to reducing energy consumption, it also increased the service life of the equipment, reducing the unavailability of maintenance. the concessionaire also replaced fixed generators with clean energy; the generators are now turned off in standbye, available for emergencies

title: reforestation project (1,250,000 seedlings) at the fmp of the macacu river basin
desc: this is a project in partnership with the state water and sewage company - cedae with the objective of reforesting the main source of water collection for the supply of the municipality of niterói and neighbors, as well as restoration of its biodiversity with the implementation of greenhouses and production of 1,250,000 seedlings that were planted in the marginal protection strip (fmp) of the macacu river,  an estimated area of 500 ha. project already executed with an estimated investment of r$ 10,000,000.00 (ten million reais).

title: água viva program
desc: the água viva program has the premise of improving the management of the water resources of palmas to promote the best distribution and availability of water for the urban and rural population, with the concern and due care mainly in rural and environmental conservation areas, where are the main watersheds and the recharge areas of water bodies. the água viva program is organized with 02 (two) components of investments, whose main actions were highlighted in subcomponents for better understanding and evaluation of the execution, being the focus of the actions in the watersheds of the sub-basin watersheds that cover the municipality. i: planning and implementation of actions aimed at the recovery, preservation, conservation and monitoring of streams and their respective springs; component ii: identification of streams, springs or water eyes in municipal territory, of special interest for environmental protection and those destined for public supply.

desc: the project foresees the realization of a training course to prepare rural and indigenous producers to promote the protection and recovery of springs in the apa vale das cascatas and reserva caramuru; it provides for the protection and recovery of springs and the construction of small dams.

title: project of improvements and modernization of the municipal flood protection system
desc: the management of water resources has always demanded large investments, both in the implementation of treatment and sanitation systems and recovery of riparian forest in rio and arroios. water management plans are interconnected by objectives, but independently and poorly articulated, working in various areas.  in addition to the proposal for shared management and sanitation plans aimed at meeting the demands of treatment, we have proposed to integrate several initiatives and actions made the management more effective including the protection and prevention of extreme weather events because of the effects of global warming.

title: project to modernize municipal waste collection / municipal composting central project
desc: construction of a biomechanical waste treatment unit in the city, in order to promote the separation and treatment of all fractions of waste, including organic in a more sustainable way.   construction of an accelerated composting support unit with capacity for 200 ton/month.

title: expansion, improvements and modernization project in municipal bike paths and hiking trail
desc: the project foresees an expansion of 33% in the existing bike paths in the municipality, in kilometers and more improvement and modernization, with signage and controllers. in the first phase is the expansion of municipal bike paths, the construction of safe space exclusively for bicycle parking; in the second phase it is intended to build a linear park along the metropolitan train, the expansion of the hiking circuits; in the third phase the studies for the implementation of mass transport vehicle with alternative energy source (pneumatic) called aeromobile, the interconnection between transport modals to improve public transport.

title: recycles são roque
desc: the selective collection will be carried out gradually within the urban perimeter of são roque do canaã, starting at rua lourenço roldi and expanding the area of activity depending on the results of the indicators. the project "recicla são roque" will be executed by the municipal department of environment, and consists of the collection, in principle weekly, of recyclable dry waste. the collection will be carried out with the support of the trunk truck of selective collection, 01 driver and 02 waste pickers, who performed the route of approximately 1 kilometer, collecting the bags of green color, used to differentiate from the other waste, and then direct to the association of waste pickers.

title: organic agriculture
desc: currently, approximately 4,000 tons of urban green waste per year (2021) are collected by the public cleaning service, destined to 2 existing fields in our municipality (composting field and debris field). there is the primary treatment with extraction of wood from pruning, in a partnership between the city hall and the association of waste pickers - varjorecicla. we seek investment to transform all this remaining green mass into organic fertilizer, through composting, so that this material goes to rural producers and the irrigated district araras norte - dipan, present in our municipality. this positive impact will have an impact on energy efficiency and the quality and quantity of food production.

title: zero garbage city
desc: currently the municipality of varjota has a municipal system of public cleaning and free with regular selective collection that serves 100% of the urban and rural population for waste: tailings, green urban, dry recyclable, health and animal services. there is treatment and processing of green and recyclable municipal waste. all tailings are destined for the landfill in the metropolitan region of sobral. there is a private initiative that treats and benefits animal remains from fish. we do not yet have treatment or processing for residues of animal origin (cattle, poultry, pigs). special or hazardous waste is stored for reverse logistics (batteries, lamps, batteries). tires are reused in sports and education projects and initiatives, especially in the delimitation of community soccer fields and in the landscaping of public equipment. we have no solution yet for upholstery, mattresses, leftover fabrics, sofopor, sponge, which does not classify us as zero garbage.

title: selective collection
desc: the implementation of selective collection, according to pmgirs, is planned from 2019, and will begin in the neighborhoods set citizen, dawn, dr. silvio leite, jardim primavera, santa tereza, tancredo neves caimbé, buritis and jardim floresta, however the associations and cooperative, constituted by low-income people, who survive basically from the trade of recyclable waste,  are deployed at the other end of the city. the distance will make the collection impossible due to the need to transport the recyclables to the associations' and cooperative, thus the president of the living land association, aiming to ensure the livelihood of its associates and dependents is proposing to carry out selective collection in the new city neighborhood. recycling implies a significant reduction in the levels of environmental pollution, control of diseases that spread due to the indiscriminate accumulation of waste, dignifies waste pickers when they are recognized and remunerated for the work performed, besides avoiding the waste of natural resources, through the saving of energy and raw materials. this project has as general objective the implementation of selective collection in the new city neighborhood by the terra viva association as a recycling company based in the new city neighborhood. present concrete results of selective collection in the new city neighborhood. strive for human dignity with the generation of employment and income to waste pickers of associated recyclable materials, ensuring financial return and ensuring environmental quality in the new city neighborhood.4.  specific objectives•raise awareness and sensitize the community of the new city neighborhood about the importance of performing selective collection; •sensitize the community about the need to perform the separation of recyclable waste and delivery at ecoponto;•promote the culture of reduction, reuse, reuse and recycling;•operationalize selective collection in the nova cidade neighborhood;•implement selective collection in the nova cidade neighborhood;•create recycling waste collection routines with generators;•implement environmental education actions in the new city neighborhood;•promote the generation of employment and income;enable improvement  environmental quality, avoiding the irregular deposit of breeding sites of mosquito-borne diseases, mammals and insects;•meet the provisions of law 12.305/2010 and decree no. 7404/2010;•promote reflection on environmental problems at all levels of public administration;•stimulate the adoption of attitudes and procedures that lead to the rational use of natural resources;•reduce the inadequate disposal of solid waste;•stimulate and promote changes in the habits of  residents of the new city neighborhood. equipment needed to carry out the collection in the new city neighborhood:- 05 bicycle freighter tricycle type;- press;- ppe;- paper shredder;- shredder of plastics;- balance;- suggestion of equipment models, annex ii;- technical specifications of the equipment after definition of the models.

•sensitize the community about the need to perform the separation of recyclable waste and delivery at ecoponto;•promote the culture of reduction, reuse, reuse and recycling;•operationalize selective collection in the nova cidade neighborhood;•implement selective collection in the nova cidade neighborhood;•create recycling waste collection routines with generators;•implement environmental education actions in the new city neighborhood;•promote the generation of employment and income;enable improvement  environmental quality, avoiding the irregular deposit of breeding sites of mosquito-borne diseases, mammals and insects;•meet the provisions of law 12.305/2010 and decree no. 7404/2010;•promote reflection on environmental problems at all levels of public administration;•stimulate the adoption of attitudes and procedures that lead to the rational use of natural resources;•reduce the inadequate disposal of solid waste;•stimulate and promote changes in the habits of  residents of the new city neighborhood. equipment needed to carry out the collection in the new city neighborhood:- 05 bicycle freighter tricycle type;- press;- ppe;- paper shredder;- shredder of plastics;- balance;- suggestion of equipment models, annex ii;- technical specifications of the equipment after definition of the models.

title: joão pessoa municipal solid waste management plan
desc: the municipal plan for integrated solid waste management of joão pessoa (pmgirs-jp) includes a specific program for the environmental recovery of the roger dump. this is the "new roger" program, which aims to provide roger's community with a living area in the space where the old dump worked. this program includes 3 actions, namely: completing environmental recovery of the three remaining cells of the roger dump, refitting an existing project for the implementation of a park or green area and promoting geotechnical and environmental studies to define the possibilities of ventures in the former roger dump.

title: joão pessoa municipal solid waste management plan
desc: the pmgirs-jp has the specific program for civil construction waste (ccr) that includes, among its projects, the "re-build" port, which, in turn, aims to structure the management of ccr in the municipality of joão pessoa. among the actions of this project are: to promote feasibility studies of implementation and implement two areas of transhipment and screening of ccr, three rcc recyclers and ten ecopoints for the collection of small volumes of ccr

title: joão pessoa municipal solid waste management plan
desc: pmgirs-jp has the "technological route" program that concerns the treatment of municipal solid waste with environmentally appropriate and economically viable technologies. among the actions listed in this program is to promote the characterization of rsu and rcc every two years.

title: joão pessoa springs and water bodies monitoring program
desc: the project aims to: map the main springs of the hydrographic basins in the municipality of joão pessoa, identifying them with metric coordinates, field visits and subsequent elaboration of shape file files; develop plans and actions to protect the springs and water bodies of sub-basins, as well as recovery plans for the springs that require conservation interventions; obtain the environmental diagnosis of the conditions of the springs and water bodies of the main tributaries; subsidize inspection actions and licensing processes of the environment secretariat of the municipality of joão pessoa

title: strengthening the apps program
desc: the project seeks the demarginalization of urban streams and the integration of natural spaces of streams into socio-environmental conviviality. in this, it is necessary the contract for the elaboration of a project for the implementation of a linear park in urban streams.

title: management of analysis of water resources and effluents
desc: the project aims to manage and maintain water resources and effluents in the municipality, diagnosing and monitoring the quality of water in the city.  through specific instruments and apparatus (technical), samples should be collected on site for laboratory analysis and develop the balances of the waters used within the municipality.

title: integrated solid waste management
desc: the project seeks to implement selective collection within the municipality, to meet the municipal plan for integrated solid waste management (pgrs). through implementation, the project can promote a sustainable benefit and well-being throughout the municipality around the collection of solid waste.

title: implementation of the meliponário in the josepha coelho park - o peo
desc: the project seeks to establish the creation of three species (at least) of native social bees without stingin the josepha coelho park (petrolina area). the monitoring and management of these hives through educational activities, consolidation of knowledge about stingless bees, their importance for maintaining life on the planet and agricultural production on site. given the situation of decreased populations of bees, the establishment of a meliponário within the park seeks the awareness of bees for the activities of fauna and flora, showing the importance in the role of pollination and also of disembodying the popularly negative images it imposes on bee species.

title: water + clean
desc: linear parks are named because they form "lines" of green areas in the urban setting along river and stream courses. these areas help in the preservation and revitalization of urban streams, which are taken over by the pollution by domestic sewage. these parks contribute to the interconnection between various areas and neighborhoods of the city, improving urban mobility, providing the emergence of leisure and contemplation areas, improving the quality of life and well-being of people. the creation of these parks transform marginalized areas with health and social problems into pleasant and healthy green areas. the park plays an important role in the climate balance and air quality of its surroundings, fully urbanized. the proposed interventions are fundamental for the re-establishment of the ecological potential of urban streams, improving water quality and reducing anthropic pressures. for this project, it is necessary to integrate the municipal secretariats to develop a multidisciplinary project that involves architectural design, urban demobility, landscape and structural.

title: application of nanotechnology for water depollution (equipment and maintenance)
desc: nanobubbles are already used in other countries to successfully clean surface water. nanobubbles produced by this type of system are usually made of air, oxygen gas or ozone. it is a sustainable and clean technology used for decontamination of rivers, streams and canals that can be carried portablely to depollution several stretches of watercourses over the months, improving water quality.

title: creation of the department for the management and maintenance of urban afforestation
desc: the project aims to improve the situation of maintenance and care of trees already planted and established in the city to allow their proper development, and avoid inconvenience to society. the tree should be treated as public equipment that must be maintained adequately by the municipality, receiving constant care, such as regular pruning, using correct techniques, phytosanitary treatment, fertilization, etc. in addition, in order for the tree not to be seen as a hindrance, it is necessary to make the appropriate choice of species for each planting site in the urban area, also ensuring the diversity of species to be planted, in addition to enjoying the socio-environmental benefits that well-maintained trees can bring to citizens. for this, it was estimated through the reference term of maintenance of the trees elaborated by amma, the costs for the implementation of a specific department for the management and maintenance of urban afforestation.

title: waste management
desc: proposal for new final disposal of household waste, transforming municipal solid waste into charcoal, carbon credit and energy efficiency. the plant performs the integrated treatment of urban waste based on recycling and carbonization by pyrolysis, which is chemical decomposition by heat. the project is shown to be a more sustainable form of waste disposal, since there is no pollution of the soil and water table. in addition, the process allows the recycling of materials that are not transformed by pyrolysis, such as glass and metals.
title+desc: waste management. proposal for new final disposal of household waste, transforming municipal solid waste into charcoal, carbon credit and energy efficiency. the plant performs the integrated treatment of urban waste based on recycling and carbonization by pyrolysis, which is chemical decomposition by heat. the project is shown to be a more sustainable form of waste disposal, since there is no pollution of the soil and water table. in addition, the process allows the recycling of materials that are not transformed by pyrolysis, such as glass and metals.

title: preparation of diagnosis and forest recomposition project of the springs of the sub-basins of ribeirão preto
desc: the present project seeks funding from the state fund for water resources - fehidro and aims to diagnose the current situation of the springs of the municipality of ribeirão preto, with respect to the forest remnant and the erosive processes of its surroundings, contributing to the flow of the pardo river and belonging to the pardo river hydrographic basin - ugrhi-04,  serving as a fundamental instrument for the definition of an efficient municipal program for the recovery of its springs. in addition to identification, it is also aimed at the elaboration of an executive project to mitigate the problems found, pointing out the priority areas and ideal recovery methodology, considering the particularity and context of each, containing actions of preparation, management, planting, indicated species, conduction and monitoring, aligned with the methodological aspects required by regulatory agencies and current legislation. as supporters in the development of the spring recovery program there is the cati / regional development office - edr, the rural union of ribeirão preto - srrp and rural association of ribeirão preto - arrp, which will act in support with the identification and intermediation of contact with the owners of rural and urban areas, who commend the areas of the springs of interest recovery,  since there is secrecy in access to real estate registration information, in addition, the participation of these actors is of fundamental importance in bringing the owners closer to the project, having this phase of presentation as strategic in the membership and implementation of restoration activities in the proposed areas.

title: vlt - light rail vehicle
desc: state government project, via emtu. first phase (santos - são vicente) implemented.  second phase (current santos - santos centro) in progress. next phases (são vicente - continental area; praia grande and other municipalities of baixada santista) in studies.

title: transfer of biotechnological strategies for the recovery of green areas in urban sectors of the metropolitan region
desc: develop a comprehensive biotechnological platform for the recovery of urban green areas based on an afforestation technology with native species of the metropolitan region, which technifies all the steps of the process, from the propagation to the establishment of the trees in the field, maximizing the use of water and requiring less care of the forested areas. develop an in vitro propagation system for native species characterized by molecular analysis. (peumo, quillay, maitén, quebracho, guayacán and huingán) develop bioinputs (biological fertilizers) based on soil microorganisms from the same locality to be intervened, which promote the growth of the selected tree species. deliver genetically diverse native plants fertilized with bioinputs based on plant growth-promoting bacteria for afforestation. expected results and/or minimum viable product: - characterization of at least two (2) plant growth promoting bacteria isolated from wild mri environments. manual of in vitro propagation of native tree species of the metropolitan area- propagation of native trees from in vitro culture (peumo, quillay, maitén, quebracho, guayacán and huingán), genetically characterized. total population of plants: 1200 units 200 per species and 50 units / accession, 5 different accessions.- number of attendees to technical meetings / visits (50 people). innovative merit: development of a comprehensive afforestation service that involves biotechnological variables: in vitro propagation, molecular genetic characterization and development of bioinputs based on bacteria that promote plant growth, to make them available to the municipalities associated with the fic project.
title+desc: transfer of biotechnological strategies for the recovery of green areas in urban sectors of the metropolitan region. develop a comprehensive biotechnological platform for the recovery of urban green areas based on an afforestation technology with native species of the metropolitan region, which technifies all the steps of the process, from the propagation to the establishment of the trees in the field, maximizing the use of water and requiring less care of the forested areas. develop an in vitro propagation system for native species characterized by molecular analysis. (peumo, quillay, maitén, quebracho, guayacán and huingán) develop bioinputs (biological fertilizers) based on soil microorganisms from the same locality to be intervened, which promote the growth of the selected tree species. deliver genetically diverse native plants fertilized with bioinputs based on plant growth-promoting bacteria for afforestation. expected results and/or minimum viable product: - characterization of at least two (2) plant growth promoting bacteria isolated from wild mri environments. manual of in vitro propagation of native tree species of the metropolitan area- propagation of native trees from in vitro culture (peumo, quillay, maitén, quebracho, guayacán and huingán), genetically characterized. total population of plants: 1200 units 200 per species and 50 units / accession, 5 different accessions.- number of attendees to technical meetings / visits (50 people). innovative merit: development of a comprehensive afforestation service that involves biotechnological variables: in vitro propagation, molecular genetic characterization and development of bioinputs based on bacteria that promote plant growth, to make them available to the municipalities associated with the fic project.

title: diagnosis and recovery plan of the urban lagoons of concepción
desc: the objective of the study was to carry out a complete and comprehensive diagnosis of the five urban lagoons of the city of concepción (laguna redonda, las tres pascualas, lo galindo, lo méndez and lo custodio) regarding limnological parameters, water quality, sediments, flora, fauna and a survey of social perception. based on the diagnosis made, a recovery plan was developed for each lagoon. the study determined that the main problem presented by all the lagoons lies in the excessive load of nutrients (nitrogen and phosphorus), which reach the lagoon through rainwater channels that pay direct or indirect taxes on them. the project profiles of the recovery plan for each lagoon of concepción are attached.

title: communal electromobility
desc: it seeks to encourage electromobility in the commune, through the acquisition of an electric bus available for the community and municipal electric fleet. this is expected to reduce the suo of transport with fossil fuels and to strengthen the use of sustainable transport.

title: conservation of quebrada de macul park
desc: the quebrada de macul park is a natural area of the commune of peñalolén that has been historically occupied by the residents of the commune. it serves as a space for recreation, sport, disconnection among other uses. this great place, with a wide biodiversity and privileged ecosystem, requires investing in infrastructure for its correct use and care. providing the trails, improving the signage and that the park rangers have better working conditions, will make the place safer for visitors and better preserve the place.

title: water efficiency green areas of peñalolén
desc: peñalolén is a commune that has worked hard to increase and maintain green areas in its territory. this work has brought with it innumerable associated benefits, which have an impact on the quality of life of all its inhabitants. parallel to this, conserving these green areas brings with it great challenges. due to the social characteristics of the commune and the needs present in the citizens, unfortunately there are great losses of water in these areas. some due to theft, others due to carelessness and a large percentage due to leaks that are impossible to identify, are part of the causes of this problem. for this reason, it is sought to be able to install a control system in alliance with the company (tecpa) that allows to control the volume of water that is used in each green area. with this, it is expected to improve the service and protect this privileged resource

title: strengthening ecoparque environmental education center
desc: ecoparque is an environmental education center that works on the circular economy to teach from children to older adults, how to improve their environmental practices at home. from the blocking of their waste through composting or vermicomposting, such as orchards, climate change, energy and biodigesters, are some of the issues they address in the place. today it has a high demand, which due to infrastructure issues cannot be answered 100%. for this reason, it seeks to enhance this place, improve its infrastructure and provide more operators who can improve the service and experience of its visitors. with this, it is expected to reach more people and generate a change of behavior in society

title: strengthening inclusive recycling program
desc: this program helps to dignify and formalize the work of grassroots waste pickers in the commune, people who manage to support their families thanks to this work. their work consists of recovering and recycling waste from the homes of the commune, revaluing them and incorporating them into the chain of use and delivering them an adequate management (they group, treat, repair and sell these products to generate their salary.). therefore, strengthening and improving the conditions and tools of this program would not only make it more effective and efficient, but would also help improve the quality of work of waste pickers and increase their opportunities.  in addition to this, they contribute to more people generating habits of responsibility with respect to waste, reducing the amount of these that go to landfills and the associated ghgs. it is necessary to provide better conditions for waste pickers, thus improving their quality of work

title: communal energy management. solar schools
desc: it seeks to complete the work done in 6 public schools in the commune, replicating this initiative in the rest of the municipal schools and ideally encourage private companies to invest in photovoltaic solar panels, solar thermal, heat pumps and led energy. then be replicated in all the public enclosures of the commune (municipal and health buildings). finally and over time, his seeks to be able to bring this business and technical model to the residential area. with this, children from the most vulnerable communities of the commune will be able to benefit, accessing technologies that are beyond their reach.

title: sustainable economic reactivation plan
desc: this project seeks a reactivation of the local economy through the promotion of sustainable and environmentally friendly ventures, where training, tools are delivered and collaborative networks between local companies are generalized.
title+desc: sustainable economic reactivation plan. this project seeks a reactivation of the local economy through the promotion of sustainable and environmentally friendly ventures, where training, tools are delivered and collaborative networks between local companies are generalized.

title: implementation of organic waste dehydration technology in housing complexes
desc: an organic waste recycling system will be piloted, where the treatment and reuse is proposed in the same dependencies of the housing complex through the habilitation of an organic green point, which is capable of transforming the organic waste generated, daily, into organic fertilizer and condensation water, usable in the green areas. a preliminary study determined that the sector has an estimated generation potential of 380 kilos per day. it is relevant to note that the organic green point will incorporate specialized technology that has not been implemented in chile, being pioneers in local organic management. this technology consists of a dehydrating machine that divides and collects the organic and liquid fraction, both usable for the strengthening of green areas. for compliance with pladeco in its guideline 4.2.1. promote the reduction, separation and recycling of household solid waste (this program is financed with the cleaning fee), and seeks to test models that allow us to advance to be a zero waste commune, since this neighborhood unit would contemplate a complete management plan for organic and inorganic waste.

title: sustainable providence: towards carbon neutrality
desc: the project includes a series of energy efficiency improvements in 8 municipal educational establishments and two sports centers. these improvements include the technological replacement of gas boilers to heat pump systems for both domestic hot water (educational establishments and sports centers) and for the swimming pools of both sports centers; replacement of led luminaires in the 8 establishments; 2 photovoltaic plants under law 21.118 in establishments and one in a sports center and the replacement of an internal combustion vehicle by an electric vehicle destined to the control direction.
title+desc: sustainable providence: towards carbon neutrality. the project includes a series of energy efficiency improvements in 8 municipal educational establishments and two sports centers. these improvements include the technological replacement of gas boilers to heat pump systems for both domestic hot water (educational establishments and sports centers) and for the swimming pools of both sports centers; replacement of led luminaires in the 8 establishments; 2 photovoltaic plants under law 21.118 in establishments and one in a sports center and the replacement of an internal combustion vehicle by an electric vehicle destined to the control direction.

title: water efficiency in municipal establishments with high water consumption
desc: implementation of systems to regulate the pressure of the drinking water supply system of the 12 educational establishments of providencia, achieving savings of an average of 40% of water consumption. this technology allows to regulate the water pressure according to the specific schedule and use, also managing to identify the existence of leaks and any type of water loss. currently there are important problems of inefficiency and misuse of water, added to the economic deficit in the educational field, which is why savings initiatives promote better economic and environmental management. pressure regulation generates concrete, verifiable and immediate results. the savings potential is variable according to the infrastructure of each establishment but there are cases reported in the rm where savings reach 78% of total consumption. on average per school, savings are projected over 10,000 m3 / year equivalent to 4 olympic swimming pools. it is important to consider that water consumption savings cushion the costs associated with investment
title+desc: water efficiency in municipal establishments with high water consumption. implementation of systems to regulate the pressure of the drinking water supply system of the 12 educational establishments of providencia, achieving savings of an average of 40% of water consumption. this technology allows to regulate the water pressure according to the specific schedule and use, also managing to identify the existence of leaks and any type of water loss. currently there are important problems of inefficiency and misuse of water, added to the economic deficit in the educational field, which is why savings initiatives promote better economic and environmental management. pressure regulation generates concrete, verifiable and immediate results. the savings potential is variable according to the infrastructure of each establishment but there are cases reported in the rm where savings reach 78% of total consumption. on average per school, savings are projected over 10,000 m3 / year equivalent to 4 olympic swimming pools. it is important to consider that water consumption savings cushion the costs associated with investment

title: hydration points in public spaces of providencia
desc: creation of a communal network of 20 hydration points through specialized urban furniture that allows reusable bottles to be recharged with filtered drinking water, thus avoiding the consumption of disposable plastic bottles. the decisive factor of investment by sector is to have a drinking water start-up system. therefore, expanding the points in a specific area that has the starting point enabled, would imply a much smaller investment, making it feasible for the municipality. additionally, above the financial feasibility, there is the commitment to risk reduction in the face of critical heat episodes, so it is necessary to advance on the issue. these hydration points will be installed throughout the communal territory, enhancing those with the greatest influx of public. this project is part of the pladeco sustainable commune guideline, where through projects like this we will promote the reduction, reuse and recycling of waste. in addition, it is part of the heat island mitigation plans of the local climate change plan, being a concrete measure on an urban and human scale.
title+desc: hydration points in public spaces of providencia. creation of a communal network of 20 hydration points through specialized urban furniture that allows reusable bottles to be recharged with filtered drinking water, thus avoiding the consumption of disposable plastic bottles. the decisive factor of investment by sector is to have a drinking water start-up system. therefore, expanding the points in a specific area that has the starting point enabled, would imply a much smaller investment, making it feasible for the municipality. additionally, above the financial feasibility, there is the commitment to risk reduction in the face of critical heat episodes, so it is necessary to advance on the issue. these hydration points will be installed throughout the communal territory, enhancing those with the greatest influx of public. this project is part of the pladeco sustainable commune guideline, where through projects like this we will promote the reduction, reuse and recycling of waste. in addition, it is part of the heat island mitigation plans of the local climate change plan, being a concrete measure on an urban and human scale.

title: renewal of providencia's electric vehicle fleet
desc: acquisition of 11 electric vehicles, positioning the communal electric vehicle fleet and activating a progressive replacement process over time.  it is based as one of the mobility goals in the local energy strategy annexed to pladeco (specifically action a7 of electromobility), in the sustainable mobility report, the smart cities lines of action and in the pladeco in the guideline 4 of sustainable commune, in the objective of promoting energy efficiency in the commune and reducing the environmental impact of municipal activities. electric vehicles have a series of social and environmental benefits, positioning providencia as a sustainable commune, since they reduce noise, do not emit pollutants and the current market meets comfort standards referring to the minimum needs of the municipal fleet. in addition, its operation is aligned with the new maximum speed standards (50 km / h) and the public space programs calles vivas and innovation lines. given the positioning of markets and after-sales services, incorporating maintenance and insurance, medium-load gamma models are projected, such as the z.e. line of renault kangoo. additionally, the renewal of charging points is included.

title: solar distributed generation systems
desc: implementation of solar distributed generation systems for the electricity supply of common spaces in residential buildings of the commune, added with a complete replacement of the luminaire of the same common space. this achieves optimal levels of energy efficiency, shortening the return on investment periods. the total installation of 100 kwp and replacement to led luminaire is proposed, where estimated 80% of the investment is associated with photovoltaic systems and 20% with luminaire replacement. this project is based on the success of the fie 2018 call with 467 applications, many of them complete buildings, where there were only 89 available places. the level of impact and citizen interest is such that prioritization is required for energy reconversion, also following the strategic guidelines that the government and the country have followed in terms of renewable energies. like fie's barrio solar project, the application of a co-payment leasing model is proposed, avoiding a direct investment by the neighbors, since the system is paid with the savings that the same system generates, reducing gaps and avoiding excluding neighbors with economic limitations. during the leasing period, the awarded company manages and maintains the photovoltaic systems. the application in residential buildings exponentially increases the number of beneficiaries, and the parameters that will be considered will be aspects of technical fatibility, available surface, pre-existing led luminaire, territorial distribution and order of registration.

title: seed banks of native flora for the commune of santiago
desc: it seeks to implement living seed banks for the commune of santiago, this in order to promote environmental education and the increase of native flora species available in the territory, this due to its adaptability to the conditions of the area. currently the commune of santiago has few green areas available for the number of inhabitants and floating population of the commune, a situation that decreases the quality of life of the population. it seeks to implement live seed banks of native flora in schools, parks, environmental educational center, clean point parque de los reyes.

title: promotion of the incorporation of non-conventional renewable energies and energy efficiency to commercial premises in galleries through the program "energy galleries in the center of santiago"
desc: in the commune of santiago there are 77 commercial galleries, which are an important part of the identity of the center of the commune. to carry out energy work with galleries, it is proposed to implement a pilot project with the matte gallery taking advantage of its internal organization because they have legal personality. project costs unknown

title: reuse of water for irrigation of o'higgins park
desc: the commune of santiago has 5 large parks under its administration and one of them is the o'higgins park with a total area of 80 hectares, characterized by its long periods of history and extensive green areas with trees and grass. inside the park you can find various facilities such as an environmental educational center, spaces for cultural events, skateboarding, heated pool, etc. the proposed project seeks to reuse the water of the temperate olympic pool of the commune of santiago in order to allocate a second use of water for the irrigation of the green areas of the park. this has been thought due to the amount of water from the heated pool (an area of 1,250 m2) and the drought situation that chile and specifically the metropolitan region is going through, therefore, we believe that it is an initiative that represents a great potential for climate action. to allocate the water to a second use it is necessary to generate a decantation process in order to reduce those components harmful to the species and the soil. preliminary feasibility studies are available.

title: vermicomposteras / compost bins for santiago
desc: currently the municipality has been awarded a regional development fund (environment area) to buy 100 vermicomposteras that will be destined to family groups of the commune in order to ensure an adequate management of organic waste, preventing it from reaching final disposal in a landfill. the action is focused on mitigating climate change. this initiative has already presented good results in other communes of the country and also around the world, so it seeks to expand a second stage of the program with greater delivery of vermicomposteras (buildings) or compost bins (houses).  the program has advice, accompaniment and monitoring to estimate emission reductions. partial funding is expected to be sought for the implementation of the second stage.

title: trams for santiago
desc: the commune of santiago has a wide network of tram rails that no longer operate, but that are located in some streets of the city, which is why, in the barrio yungay sector, the municipality intends to realize a project that would allow to implement a circuit of approximately 4 km for the displacement of neighbors and tourists,  with the purpose that this mode of transport at some point can expand and become part of the public transport system. as this project is still under pre-evaluation, the investment amounts are unknown.

title: construction of the quebrada-honda urban park in puerto varas
desc: in this design, a study must be carried out for the construction of a municipal park on an area of 3.2 hectares with specialties of calculation, architecture, water studies, electricity, soil mechanics, landscaping, habilitation of green areas, trails, viewpoints, walkways, hygienic services, covered areas, spaces for children's games, among others.

title: replacement of public lighting puerto varas
desc: the project to replace public lighting in puerto varas consists of changing the luminaire's technology, replacing the old conventional lighting system with led lights that reduce the consumption of electrical energy.

title: diagnosis model of integral management of municipal solid waste for the metropolitan region
desc: the "diagnosis model of integral management of municipal solid waste for the metropolitan region" is an initiative whose investment is destined to the methodological development, survey and systematized collection of data, analytical description of the current and prospective situation, with emphasis on the financial, territorial and environmental configuration of the management of municipal solid waste (msm) in the metropolitan region of santiago. the result of the study must arrive at a model that provides one or more forms of practical and financial management to transit and achieve the circular management of msw in the metropolitan region.

title: clean turn
desc: giro limpio is a voluntary national program, administered by the energy sustainability agency (agenciase), which seeks to certify and recognize the efforts made by cargo transport companies in the field of sustainability and energy efficiency. in addition, the giro limpio program certifies cargo generating companies that prefer certified transporters giro limpio, thus contributing to reducing energy consumption and emissions of greenhouse gases (ghg) and other local pollutants that affect people's health, reducing the environmental impact of the various value chains in our country. objectives:-improve the energy efficiency of the cargo transport sector, by reducing fuel consumption.- reduce the costs of the cargo transport sector, increasing its competitiveness.- reduce the costs of the cargo transport sector, increasing its competitiveness.

title: social recycling - zero emissions
desc: the project considers the implementation of an electric 3-ton cargo transport truck and the infrastructure for charging the battery of this truck. this charging infrastructure will be implemented in the las palmas clean point located in los tilos 3611 that is owned by the municipality, where the collection of the recycle removed from the 34 green points of the commune is carried out, therefore, it corresponds to the place of beginning and end of the daily route of the truck and the place where the vehicle is parked when it is not in use. for the operation of the charging point, a connection will be made directly from the junction of the clean point, enabling a dedicated board for the loading system. the proposed wallbox charger will be implemented next to the recycling storage sector and is located in the same place where the used fuel vehicle is currently parked for these purposes, so it will not be necessary to enable additional infrastructure for the space for parking the truck. general objective to develop a scalable and replicable business model, to implement electromobility projects in the activities developed around communal recycling, with a social focus and around local energy development, for the promotion of efficient transport systems in the commune of renca, through public-private cooperation, allowing to generate synergy between the community,  the state and the private sector specific objectives: analyze the transport requirements of the recycling service of the commune of renca; select an electric vehicle that replaces the use of fossil fuel vehicles, for recycling in the commune of renca; implement a vehicle and electric charging infrastructure, for its operation in recycling transport activities; promote resilient and sustainable transport with the environment, acting in accordance with the processes of change and global energy transition. for the development of the project, the following actors are identified: directorate of environment, hygiene and ornamentation: from the dimao, the following actors emerge, with specific roles and guidelines around the project: recycling team of the municipality of renca: its purpose is to coordinate and manage all the activities related to the recycling service of the commune,  both in its current operation and in the growth and improvement of the service as such. energy efficiency unit: aims to verify and coordinate the correct operation of the municipality's electric vehicle fleet, including vehicle maintenance processes, the correct use of the electric charger and charging times. technology providers: correspond to those who market in chile vehicles and electric charging infrastructure, who have the interest of selling technologies, performing implementation, maintenance and after-sales services. private companies with electromobility lines: correspond to companies that within their portfolio of services and products seek to develop electromobility projects for their customers and prospects community of renca: residents of the commune who are benefited by having different points for the deposit of recycling material and who have the interest of maintaining the recycling withdrawal service that ensures the sustainability of the operation of the points recycling. additionally, the renquiena population is the one who will directly make visible the promotion of electromobility by the municipality, by incorporating a sustainable service for the community.

title: guarantee the representativeness of the ecosystems that make up the main ecological structure of the municipality of manizales, as a sustainable climate action.
desc: to contribute to compliance with national guidelines on climate change issues, the mayor's office of manizales began to purchase environmental protection properties; however, the effort should focus on ecological restoration, which in some way contributed to the reduction of greenhouse gases in the city, among other environmental aspects. therefore, the search for institutional alliances with actors of the environmental ecosystem of the region began, to join forces in the planting of plant species that would work with the ecological structure of the environment. it is there that entities such as emas, chec and corpocaldas appear, who are integrated around the integral management of forests, water resources and climate change mitigation. ecological restoration provides a wide variety of benefits that guide the recomposition of ecosystem services such as supply, regulation, cultural and support that largely support the economic development of the municipality: as for the supply services we have raw materials, fresh water and food, in the regulation services we have the regulation of the climate,  air quality, carbon sequestration and storage, moderation of extreme weather events, prevention of soil erosion. in cultural services we have nature tourism, aesthetic appreciation and inspiration for culture, art and design. finally, in the support services we have the habitat for species of flora and fauna, as well as the conservation of genetic biodiversity.

title: promote efficient solutions with the ecological environment that promote the quality of urban habitat and in turn support the management of climate change in the municipality of manizales.
desc: although, all the actions that have been carried out in terms of green infrastructure are not innovative in product, as they are a replica of other national and international bets, if they turn out to be innovative for the city in their implementation. for example, in some of the parks delivered so far in the city in the network of green parks, the energy transition is being implemented taking advantage of the resources available in the environment as renewable energies, an idea that has been promoted in different capital cities of the country. manizales en bici was one of the first public bicycle systems in the city, marking an important differential, since the service is provided free of charge. urban gardens are a strategy implemented since 2020, which to date have 24 orchards, which bets on the reactivation of public spaces, helps food security, and contributes to the processing of organic waste.

title: use of organic waste (composting)
desc: reduction of gel emissions associated with waste from the city of neiva.-promote the efforts currently carried out by the company responsible for managing neiva waste, to position composting as a preferred management system and easy implementation for the recovery of the organic fraction of the waste.-compost is a substitute for artificial nitrogen fertilizers,  so it indirectly helps reduce emissions from agriculture associated with the generation of n20 by use of this type of fertilizer. it is proposed in the first years to implement a separation at source in a time horizon of 10 years, starting in 2020, composting 400 tons per year with waste from gardens, pruning, parks and green areas and even from the organic fraction collected in large markets, until reaching, progressively, 4,000 tons.-in parallel, measures will be adopted to ensure the existence of a market for compost that makes it profitable.-in the long term,  when there is already an infrastructure for the collection of the household organic fraction and for the sale of compost, a large-scale composting plant will be developed, with the capacity to treat 40,000 tons per year, which also treats the rest of the biodegradable fraction of the waste generated. this plant will be designed based on lessons learned in the pilot plant.
title+desc: use of organic waste (composting). reduction of gel emissions associated with waste from the city of neiva.-promote the efforts currently carried out by the company responsible for managing neiva waste, to position composting as a preferred management system and easy implementation for the recovery of the organic fraction of the waste.-compost is a substitute for artificial nitrogen fertilizers,  so it indirectly helps reduce emissions from agriculture associated with the generation of n20 by use of this type of fertilizer. it is proposed in the first years to implement a separation at source in a time horizon of 10 years, starting in 2020, composting 400 tons per year with waste from gardens, pruning, parks and green areas and even from the organic fraction collected in large markets, until reaching, progressively, 4,000 tons.-in parallel, measures will be adopted to ensure the existence of a market for compost that makes it profitable.-in the long term,  when there is already an infrastructure for the collection of the household organic fraction and for the sale of compost, a large-scale composting plant will be developed, with the capacity to treat 40,000 tons per year, which also treats the rest of the biodegradable fraction of the waste generated. this plant will be designed based on lessons learned in the pilot plant.

title: energy use at the los angeles landfill
desc: in the municipality of neiva, a per capita production of waste in 2014 of 0.2260 tons/inhabitant is estimated. i00% of the waste generated in the urban area is taken to the los angeles landfill. through this action, a correct system of extraction of the biogas generated in the landfill will be implemented. currently a passive extraction is carried out with a subsequent combustion without energy use in an aritorcha. however, better management and energy use of the biogas generated can be achieved. to this end, an active collection is proposed through wells and catchment ducts, and its transformation into electrical energy through motoralternator groups. in this way, it will go from a collection of 30% to a capture of 65%. this action reduces emissions through two different mechanisms: 1. reduction associated with the reduction of eol emissions by generating waste in the study area, 2. reduction of emissions associated with the replacement of electricity from the grid, by clean electricity generated in the engines. it is estimated that in 2050 5.9 mw could be obtained. a small part of this electricity production would go to self-consumption (about 7%), and the rest would be connected to the grid by replacing the electricity from the grid with clean energy generated in the engines.

title: environmental education and citizen awareness
desc: environmental awareness seeks that a user, aware of the environmental impact of their activities, apply sustainability criteria in their decisions. awareness-raising strategies must in any case be accompanied by other policies that try to reduce the gap between the rest of the conditions between products and services: making public transport or non-motorized means more accessible and attractive for the citizen, facilitating the means for recycling or partially subsidizing the most sustainable options. the result of awareness is a change in attitudes and habits that have a direct impact on the improvement of the environment, without detriment to economic development and social well-being. in addition, it promotes participatory democracy, by having a better informed population with a greater sense of co-responsibility in the management of the environment. in this case, seeking to influence the reduction of gel emissions, the main sectors on which to work awareness would be:1. energy mobile sources: an individual with equal awareness will tend to select the most sustainable mode of transport.2. energy stationary sources (specifically residential subsector): criteria for green purchase and efficient use of energy.3. waste: an individual aware will generate less garbage and will try to make and will even be able to take the variable in their decision-making, efficient use of water in their home, reducing with all this the emissions associated with waste. this project aims to stimulate awareness through the praes through two lines: training of monitors and provision of resources. in addition, it is contemplated to generate direct contacts between schoolchildren and environmental professionals. in this aspect, it is proposed to orient the work of practitioners towards this alternative. to do this, the mayor's office will organize, coordinate and assume the cost of their insurance policies.4. carrying out extracurricular activities that capture the attention of children by creating a network between neiva schools so that they carry out joint activities, such as competitions, exchanges of experiences and visits to environmental management facilities. the pncc's environmental education approach must be ensured.

title: voluntary day without car and motorcycle
desc: any action to contribute to the environment generates positive impacts, which is why strategies are promoted from different sectors or guilds to improve the quality of life and guarantee the right to a healthier or healthier environment. from the ministry of environment and sustainable rural development, the coordination of activities framed to the fulfillment of the agreement 013 of 2015 was carried out, which aim to publicize the environmental noise conditions present in different sectors of the city of neiva, reduction of co2 emissions and through the vehicle count calculate the carbon footprint,  during the day of the day without car and motorcycle in the city. environmental noise and atmospheric emissions are monitored during the day.

title: improvement of the bicycle path network
desc: the city of neiva for its size and topography presents key characteristics for the use of the bicycle, however, there is a lack of specific infrastructures for this means of transport. this action affects the need to have pleasant and comfortable infrastructure for this type of actors with the aim of removing the incentive to use motorized modes of transport. it is proposed to place the bicycle as a true option of articulated displacement to the urban transport system. the success of this measure lies in the continuity of its circuits, the ease, safety and ability to articulate to public transport. as for safety, it is necessary to create an adequate and articulated network of exclusive lanes, thus avoiding that the cyclist has to share the road with cars. for the bicycle to become a key element of mobility in the municipality, the network of bike lanes must favor intermodality. on the one hand, it must connect with the main infrastructures of collective public transport and on the other hand it must reach those destinations that attract an important number of workers and visitors, for which the needs of users, the location of activities and tourist sites, as well as the main educational centers and places of labor concentration will be taken into account. it is proposed to develop a network of bicycle routes accompanied by thermal comfort measures such as urban trees, progressively, until reaching 76.5 km in 2050. in addition, the implementation of a public bicycle system is being studied. it offers a low-price rental regime or free loan of bicycles in urban centers, promoted by the public administration and designed for everyday use.

title: improve the provision of collective public transport service in intermediate cities, in order to structure competitive, efficient and equitable cities, which allow citizens to have safe mobility opportunities under economic principles.
desc: the strategic public transport service - setp has been developing the mobility master plan for neiva. this plan proposes the articulation between a set of actions, technically and financially viable, aimed at improving the mobility system of the city, guaranteeing equity, sustainability and improvement in the quality of life of the inhabitants. it is intended in this way to physically, operationally and farely integrate the collective public transport system, under the following scheme: [11system and control center of transit and transport information: essentially what is sought is a change in the traditional business scheme to one based on new technologies, in such a way that the operating systems allow greater control and better planning of the service. ilí unified collection system: the money collected is deposited in a fiduciary who is responsible for making the payment to the transport operators (trunks and feeders). fl reorganization of collective public transport: optimization of routes, adaptation of infrastructure to the new operating conditions of the collective public transport system and construction of interchange points in the center. it would go from a coverage of 67% of the urban area to 94%. the master plan contemplates diagnosing the mobility, urbanism, environmental, legal, socioeconomic and financial sectors. at this point, it is important to include as a proposal and within the public transport system the replacement and scrapping of buses that run on acpm fuels, or vehicles that operate with natural gas. this measure has a potential reduction of 82370 t coe.
title+desc: improve the provision of collective public transport service in intermediate cities, in order to structure competitive, efficient and equitable cities, which allow citizens to have safe mobility opportunities under economic principles.. the strategic public transport service - setp has been developing the mobility master plan for neiva. this plan proposes the articulation between a set of actions, technically and financially viable, aimed at improving the mobility system of the city, guaranteeing equity, sustainability and improvement in the quality of life of the inhabitants. it is intended in this way to physically, operationally and farely integrate the collective public transport system, under the following scheme: [11system and control center of transit and transport information: essentially what is sought is a change in the traditional business scheme to one based on new technologies, in such a way that the operating systems allow greater control and better planning of the service. ilí unified collection system: the money collected is deposited in a fiduciary who is responsible for making the payment to the transport operators (trunks and feeders). fl reorganization of collective public transport: optimization of routes, adaptation of infrastructure to the new operating conditions of the collective public transport system and construction of interchange points in the center. it would go from a coverage of 67% of the urban area to 94%. the master plan contemplates diagnosing the mobility, urbanism, environmental, legal, socioeconomic and financial sectors. at this point, it is important to include as a proposal and within the public transport system the replacement and scrapping of buses that run on acpm fuels, or vehicles that operate with natural gas. this measure has a potential reduction of 82370 t coe.

title: neiva wastewater treatment plant
desc: currently in the municipality of neiva no wastewater treatment plant operates, so the wastewater generated by the inhabitants of the study area is discharged into the magdalena river without having received any prior treatment. this situation generates an environmental problem due to pollution of the river systems to which the wastewater discharges arrive, without prior treatment. this action is in line with the "sanitation and dumping management plan" of the neiva aqueduct and sewerage company - las ceibas, concessionaire of the service, and the neiva development plan 2016-2019. in this last document it is planned to have two wastewater treatment plants (wwtp) by 2019, one in the santander bridge with an approximate coverage of 86% of the wastewater of neiva where two collectors are connected and the second in the discharge site of the el venado collector in the non-magdalena. however, before building the wwtp, the footrests must concentrate on the collection of wastewater, expanding the coverage and transporting it through the interconnection of the different collectors that discharge. after ensuring that adequate collection is available, the coverage of the treatment will be progressively increased, with the objective that by 2050 i00% of the wastewater generated in the urban area will be treated. on the other hand, the discharge of the treated water will be carried out in the magdalena river, which has a great capacity for dilution and self-purification due to its hydraulic conditions and flow. in parallel, additional stupidities will be carried out to control informal settlements, since people must be prevented from settling in areas without a sanitation connection, which would cause that, after the construction of the wwtp, it is again poured directly into the channel.

title: promote agroforestry and silvopastoral practices
desc: it is proposed that in the area of remaining pastures a silvopastoral system be established, using trees from the tropical dry forest ecosystem, or adapted, such as the leucaena. agroforestry and silvopastoral systems combine trees with improved grasses, and increase the beneficial effects generated by interactions between tree and shrub species, pastures and animals, stimulating nutrient cycling and improving soil conditions. in this sense, the reforestation of 3,000 ha by 2050 is proposed. these systems represent a management alternative for traditional livestock, as they allow the animal to be provided with a greater variety in its diet and a better forage offer. likewise, these systems are the opportunity to improve productive yields, but guaranteeing the conservation of the environment and reducing the environmental impact of livestock. the risks and erosive effects of natural phenomena such as drought or excess rainfall are also reduced, since there is greater water retention as organic matter increases and evapotranspiration decreases. therefore, this measure is itself a measure of adaptation to climate change. in addition, they allow to obtain income that transforms the traditional livestock activity by complementing it with others such as forestry. in this way, it is contemplated to obtain firewood for residential consumption, which will reduce the felling of natural forests. from the point of view of climate change mitigation, agroforestry and silvopastoral systems are interesting for their ability to fix carbon in the biomass of trees and crops planted.

title: solar kiosk in educational institutions in rural and urban areas
desc: exemplifying the reduction of ghg emissions by reducing the energy consumption of government institutions.-the implementation of rehabilitation measures with a focus on energy efficiency and renewable energies in public buildings is a good start for the reduction of the carbon footprint in this sector.  -awareness of the population in terms of energy efficiency.-eco-efficiency measures promoted by law 1715/2014. it is proposed to apply different energy efficiency measures (reflective paint and insulation of the roofs and external walls of the buildings, fans in the rooms, efficient lighting, etc.) and photovoltaic solar energy in the institutional buildings. -to reduce the energy consumption of institutional buildings, progress will be made in three directions: 1. active strategies for the production of renewable energy2. active strategies with high efficiency installations3. passive strategies to generate energy savingsthe installation of 87 kiosks with solar panels is proposed, covering 66 educational venues in the rural area and 20 institutions in the urban area and an installation in public space.
title+desc: solar kiosk in educational institutions in rural and urban areas. exemplifying the reduction of ghg emissions by reducing the energy consumption of government institutions.-the implementation of rehabilitation measures with a focus on energy efficiency and renewable energies in public buildings is a good start for the reduction of the carbon footprint in this sector.  -awareness of the population in terms of energy efficiency.-eco-efficiency measures promoted by law 1715/2014. it is proposed to apply different energy efficiency measures (reflective paint and insulation of the roofs and external walls of the buildings, fans in the rooms, efficient lighting, etc.) and photovoltaic solar energy in the institutional buildings. -to reduce the energy consumption of institutional buildings, progress will be made in three directions: 1. active strategies for the production of renewable energy2. active strategies with high efficiency installations3. passive strategies to generate energy savingsthe installation of 87 kiosks with solar panels is proposed, covering 66 educational venues in the rural area and 20 institutions in the urban area and an installation in public space.

title: water and territory governance in the atriz valley water region
desc: the project seeks to establish a territorial system of water governance in intermediate (pasto) and small (tangua) high mountain cities in the rhva, which share water sources and need to develop collaborative tools for their water security as a strategy for adaptation to climate change, thus achieving sustainable territories, in a context of high climate variability,  betting on a post-pandemic green recovery;  providing water for all and for life., the project has an approximate cost of 1.4 million euros

title: articulated electric buses
desc: integra as the operating company of the sitp of the city in alliance with energía de pereira, have put into circulation articulated buses as part of a pilot project. within the new concession, it is intended that the vehicle fleet has 30% of electric buses.
title+desc: articulated electric buses. integra as the operating company of the sitp of the city in alliance with energía de pereira, have put into circulation articulated buses as part of a pilot project. within the new concession, it is intended that the vehicle fleet has 30% of electric buses.

title: solar farm
desc: solar farm project in which 5% of the energy demand of the municipality of pereira is generated, through solar panels. similarly, solar systems have been installed in private companies for the consumption of their operations.

title: mega-bike
desc: project led by the institute of mobility of pereira, in which sustainability is promoted in the transport of the pereiranos, through the use of bicycles of the municipality and the stations of the same distributed in different parts of the city.

title: mega-cable
desc: project that contributes to sustainable mobility in the city of pereira, involving transport airlines
title+desc: mega-cable. project that contributes to sustainable mobility in the city of pereira, involving transport airlines

title: environmental awareness - environmental watchmen
desc: the environmental watchdog program of the pereira sas esp cleaning company promotes citizen culture based on environmental education, sensitizing the pereira community in the proper management of their waste and separation at the source, to reduce the amount of usable solid waste that reaches the landfill.

title: energy optimization in the aqueduct and sewerage of the municipality of tenjo
desc: it seeks to optimize the conventional energy consumption of the "chitasuga" drinking water extraction plant, the ebar wastewater pumping station and the wwtp wastewater treatment plant in order to reduce the municipal carbon footprint and the costs associated with its operation.

title: bird park project
desc: the bird park project is currently carrying out the studies and designs, with this project it is intended to contribute to the conservation of water resources in the protective forest reserve quebrada honda, caño parrado and buque - buenavista, through nature tourism, especially avitourism as an economic alternative to the inhabitants of the sector, reducing the anthropic pressure on the forests and water sources of the sector.

title: pilot project of the ciénaga de la virgen district park
desc: the implementation of functional unit no. 1 of the malecón parque distrital ciénaga de la virgen, will allow the establishment of the first milestone of urban renewal on the southeastern edge. this action will create a new image of city edge and tourist showcase for the entire district. it is expected that different environmental, social and urban dynamics will be generated that potentiate the need to continue with the development of the other functional units of the malecon and thus consolidate the district park. the expected scenario is to become a benchmark for urban renewal through the use of the soils created (generated) by the perimeter road, which from its execution establish the mechanisms of structuring, construction and design for the other functional units established in the master plan of the perimeter road. with the aim of turning this strategic operation into a flagship project for cartagena and that is developed from it, other complementary projects that revitalize the area of influence and benefit the settled population.

title: project integral recovery of the environmental conditions of the juan angola pipe
desc: the project seeks to i) recovery of space and relocation of housing, ii) recovery of mangrove cover, iii) construction of an interface area of public space, iv) reformulation and construction of the new road system, v) design and construction of urban environmental axes in the six sectors of the canyon.

title: sustainable neighborhood
desc: sustainable neighborhoods are those that go from being vulnerable to the consequences of climate change, climatic variations and extreme climatic events (such as runoff, floods, droughts, anm, etc.), to being neighborhoods whose community leads its own adaptation process, are able to adapt participatively to these phenomena and contribute to the improvement of the quality of life of its inhabitants. the adaptation must contemplate the intervention of housing, roads and drains, and the revitalization of public spaces and green areas in order to recover their landscape and environmental functions. in turn, this intervention must improve both access to the neighborhood and the interior roads and those that communicate it with the rest of the city; promote alternative means of transport; efficiently use household public services; generate income from job opportunities created around the sustainability of the adapted neighbourhood, and increase social cohesion and citizen participation. as a result, the intervened neighborhood must not only be adapted to climate change, but also become a space of urban prosperity.

title: storm drainage master plan
desc: the master plan of storm drains is developed with the purpose of seeking an adequate system of storm drains to minimize, correct and avoid the harmful effects of rains in the basins that make up the territory of the district of cartagena. to date, one of the city's rainwater channels has been intervened. currently, there are 8 channels that have detail engineering and budget. as for the remaining 18 channels, the designs must be made to obtain plans and construction budgets for the development of the infrastructure works.

title: promotion of a river and lake transport system within the framework of an intermodal transport system phase i
desc: the city has been planning a water transport system in its bay-system of pipes and internal lagoons-swamp of the virgin to reduce travel times in the city, while making the operation of the transcaribe mass transport system more efficient. recently it has been working with the academy, which has developed a prototype of a boat that works with solar energy and is currently under construction. it is to be defined the operation of the system. the complete project includes the adaptation of the internal bodies of water for the passage of the boats. the initial phase that is being worked on has a cost of approximately 3.5 million usd.

title: mangrove restoration in environmentally degraded areas
desc: implementation of conservation and restoration processes of degraded mangrove areas with the purpose of reducing the risk of climate change, increasing the coverage and natural regeneration processes of these ecosystems that includes the participation of key actors in the swamp of the virgin, the nuevo paraíso neighborhood isla de belén sector and the blessing of god

title: urban tree system of cartagena
desc: the project seeks to strengthen the city's urban tree system with the planting of 100,000 species of tropical dry forest, half of which would be cultivated in nurseries established and operated by the public environmental establishment of cartagena. likewise, the updating of the tree census is contemplated to define the ideal planting areas and, as far as possible, to establish environmental corridors. a monitoring system is also contemplated to quantify the ghgs these individuals would capture, together with a process of transversal environmental education in the communities.
