title: district cycle infrastructure system phase i
desc: cartagena de indias has the potential to be a cyclo-inclusive city due to its topographic characteristics, the satisfaction of bicycle users as a means of transport and its outstanding recognition as an international tourist destination. however, due to the political-administrative circumstances, the use of the bicycle has not been reflected as an alternative to the usual modes of transport and therefore only between 1 and 2% of cartagena use the bicycle mainly as a mode of transport to move in their usual activities. currently, the bicycle infrastructure network of the city of cartagena has low connectivity and significant deficiencies in terms of protection for the bicycle user and citizens who decide to use the bicycle as a means of transport. a positive impact is expected in the implementation of a district bicycle route system. benefits that are summarized in the following:•urban renewal through the recomposition of the road network.•savings in transport travel times for citizens.•savings in economic costs associated with transport in citizens.•the increase in the number of bicycle users in the district of cartagena. •increase the number of routes in sustainable means of transport in the city that contribute to the reduction of ghg greenhouse gases.•the creation of new businesses in the vicinity of the bicycle infrastructure that contribute to the post-2020 economic reactivation, type offer of goods and services for sale and maintenance of bicycles.•the use of the bicycle has a positive impact on the health of its users since it reduces the risk of problems •implementing an infrastructure for cycling allows to generate a modal change, that is, it stimulates citizens to start using the bicycle as a mode of transport. • traffic management and reduction of road accidents and accidents since bicycle users should not compete for space with vehicles. • guarantee in the public offer of a new mode of transport in the city. this impact will be seen especially in localities 1 and 3, historical and north caribbean locality and industrial locality.  of the road network of the locality 1, it will represent 16.6 kilometers, approximately and of the locality 3 about 5.5 kilometers approximately. that is, it represents an urban renewal in most of the territory of the district of cartagena.

title: construction of the first stage of the environmental park and hydraulic and environmental recovery works on the manzanares river in the city of santa marta
desc: the alternative to be developed consists of the intervention 17,000 linear meters divided into 2 sections, as well: the first, which will be developed along 16,180 meters between the fourth race (4a) and the bonda sector, consists of cleaning and removing solid waste from the channel. the second, which will be developed along 820 meters, between the fourth race (4a) and the mouth of the manzanares river in the bay of santa marta, los cocos sector, includes the following activities: perform mechanical dredging of sediments and form embankment with selected material. build the slopes protection works necessary to control the erosive processes that affect the riverbed. build reservoir points to improve the recharge capacity of the aquifer and maintain an ecological flow in its channel throughout the year. build a linear park for the landscape and environmental recovery of the river. develop a reforestation program with endemic species of the manzanares river basin in its lower zone and promote this same activity in areas of private use. however, the works of the environmental park require the work of recovery of the water round of the river through the purchase of land, work that will be developed by the district mayor of santa marta through another initiative. it is important to emphasize that the project also includes an activity of elaboration of studies and designs for landscaping and urban planning works in phase iii.

title: design and execution of an environmental contest called mi barrio, mi rio, in the district of santa marta
desc: design and execute an environmental contest called mi barrio, mi rio, in order to create environmental awareness, and implement actions that contribute to reducing negative environmental impacts on water bodies, specifically in the neighborhoods located on the slopes of the manzanares, gaira and quebrada tamacá rivers, in the city of santa marta,  which aims to be developed to address the following objectives: promote citizen culture campaigns that help raise awareness among the community in each neighborhood, about the importance of keeping neighborhoods clean, contributing to the reduction of critical points that generate environmental pollution. promote and strengthen the development of initiatives in favor of the environment and the sustainable development of our ecosystems, especially in the neighborhoods located on the slopes of the manzanares, gaira and quebrada tamacá rivers.recognize the initiatives and activities that offer the best contribution to the conservation and good use of natural resources and the environment,  in the neighborhoods located on the slopes of the manzanares, gaira and quebrada tamacá rivers.

title: establishment and planning of the urban forest as a strategy for adaptation to climate change in the city of santa marta
desc: establish the technical guidelines for the implementation of strategies or efficient alternatives for the mitigation of the effects of climate change in the city of santa marta through the integral management of trees and the implementation of an urban forest, which aims to be developed to address the following objectives:implement a central urban forest as a first measure in the strategy of adaptation and mitigation of the effects of climate change in the city of santa marta. identify other areas for implementation or ecosystem connectivity. sensitize the samaria community about environmental problems related to the lack of awareness in the care of the city's forest resources. provide basic information for the design of policies and regulations that regulate landscaping activities and in general the planning of urban trees in the city of santa marta.

title: cycle-infrastructure with environmental criteria
desc: taking into account the vulnerability that urban cyclists have to local environmental conditions, mainly exposure to air pollution, this program seeks to strengthen the planning, implementation and monitoring instances of the cyclo-inclusive policy in bogotá, managing to increase the cycle-infrastructure developed under environmental criteria and strengthening governance and governance that allows compliance with both the district agreement.  804 of 2021, like the other commitments to the global development agendas (sdgs and nau) and mitigation-adaptation to climate change (paris agreement).

title: on-track control of mobile sources through the implementation of remote sensors
desc: one of the strategies to increase the coverage in the control to mobile sources and determine their environmental status under real operating conditions, is through the use of telematic control systems, such as remote sensors, which ostensibly increases the number of vehicles tested and presents results of typical emissions of the operation. this technology is similar to life-saving cameras that detect speeding, but focused on the detection of pollutant emissions in real conditions of vehicular operation. in the case of the sda, in 2019, pilot tests were carried out with remote sensors under real operating conditions, this study and others from the literature, show that it is a viable option to increase coverage and vehicular environmental monitoring in the automotive fleet, however there are challenges to solve for its application in the city,  such as:-normativity: there are no emission limits established to carry out the control by this method and that is comparable to a conventional measurement on the road. on the other hand, electronic comparisons for environmental measurements are not regulated.-standardization: there is no framework for standardization of this type of metrics at the national level.-technological: it is a method that is in the process of development worldwide, so there may be technological variations in measurement methods and metrics. -operational: the operational framework of remote sensing control must be defined, associating an operational staff to guarantee continuity in measurements, control and analysis of the results. as well as the definition of measurement points, among other parameters.-economic: it is necessary to establish what is most appropriate to carry out remote sensor control, from an outsourcing or from the purchase of measurement equipment of the city.-integration: there is a challenge of integrating the data obtained and the information and technology systems of the sda and the city. therefore, it is necessary to solve each of the unknowns, therefore, a phase of a second pilot is proposed, and in the positive case of a viable evaluation in each of the components of the control, the implementation phase is continued, in order to achieve in 2023 a real control in the city using this technology whose potential contemplates an increase of 20 times the coverage of tested vehicles.

whose potential contemplates an increase of 20 times the coverage of tested vehicles.

title: development of alternative business models for batteries in the district and circular battery utilization model
desc: the identification of alternative battery business models, such as leasing or swapping, strengthens the business model along the value chain, allowing to generate new business and work opportunities, as well as improve the gap of the high costs associated with electric vehicles. from the financing of projects focused on alternative battery business models, it will be possible to continue promoting zero- and low-emission mobility in the city, increasingly reducing the environmental impact of this sector. on the other hand, the development of models of use, reuse (second and third uses) and responsible final disposal, are part of the current and growing needs associated with electric mobility in the city and in the world. however, to date, no consolidated strategies have been identified to make the correct use of electric vehicle batteries, which has repercussions on zero-emission technologies. therefore, the need to finance programs and projects that frame models of responsible and integral use and / or disposal of batteries is foreseen, reducing the negative externalities and waste associated with zero-emission transport.

title: development of pilot project models based on hydrogen.
desc: the accelerated research and development of the potential of hydrogen as a sustainable energy responds to the current dynamics of reducing the environmental externalities associated with transport. in effect, the nation has developed the hydrogen roadmap, which sets out the hydrogen production capacity, the expected demand, the expected emission reduction impacts, the country's export potential and the regulatory measures necessary to implement the deployment. however, the development of pilot projects to evaluate this technology is necessary to understand the scope and limitations of hydrogen in a local context. therefore, the financing of pilot projects that evaluate the potential of hydrogen as a measure to reduce the environmental externalities of transport becomes an increasingly necessary necessity.

title: development of a pilot project of electric buses for educational institutions in the city of bogotá.
desc: school transport in bogotá is characterized by being highly dependent on fossil fuels as well as having a high vehicular age, which has a significant impact on the emission of pollutants such as greenhouse gases. its effects are mainly reflected in the health of children; vulnerable population that reported 176,681 cases of acute respiratory diseases in children under 5 years of age in bogotá (2020). estimates from the district secretariat of environment report that the school transport sector emits annually about 2.6 tons of pm2.5, 2.9 tons of pm10 and more than 2,600 tons of co2. currently, the district is developing the strategy of technological ascent of the school fleet. this strategy seeks to consolidate a complete diagnosis of the fleet, the identification of stakeholders, operating models, among other variables. additionally, the district is drawing up the roadmap for the electrification of the fleet in the short, medium and long term, as well as establishing the minimum principles for the development of a pilot project in the city. given the effects and impacts of this fleet on citizens, as well as the progress made by the district, the need to finance the first school bus project in the city is foreseen, in which the strategy designed by the district is put into practice, opportunities and barriers of zero-emission vehicles in the school transport sector are identified.

title: development of pilot projects of zero and low emission technologies for specialized fleets operating in the district.
desc: the fleets that provide specialized services in the city, such as ambulances, waste collection vehicles, cranes, specialized fire engines, among others, are characterized by non-commercial technologies and sometimes intensive dynamic operations. additionally, this type of fleet is characterized by operating with fossil fuels and lagging technologies, generating a high environmental impact. despite their specialized uses and intensive operations, there are still no technological models available to carry out the technological ascent of these fleets. therefore, the need to finance pilot projects focused on specialized fleets that allow generating a transition to vehicles that reduce environmental externalities, such as zero and low emission technologies, is perceived.

title: design, development, implementation and technical support of the web platform / web app - environmental and social management app for sustainable urban cargo transport
desc: from the strategic plan for the integral management of air quality, air 2030 plan, the initiative was generated based on project number 6, urban cargo transport emission reduction program (etuc), which will be immersed as a component of the environmental self-regulation program (paa), for mobile sources and includes the analysis and articulation with the restrictions on circulation,  methods of control and monitoring of mobile sources, financial instruments and incentives for the carrier, social management, among others. it is worth mentioning that social management is a very important aspect to adequately enhance the impacts of any emission mitigation initiative in the transport sector. for its development, it is necessary to generate an app and web platform as tools of "environmental and social management for the sustainable transport of urban cargo"

title: environmental labelling of vehicles in use
desc: the ministry of environment and sustainable development is structuring a vehicle environmental labeling at the national level, in order to classify vehicles according to their emission levels according to the emission standard they meet and the technology they have. in this sense, the territorial entities together with the automotive diagnostic centers are responsible for the implementation of labeling, also the district is responsible for establishing control and monitoring actions such as peak and plate according to the level of label, access to low and zero emission areas, green corridors, among others, in order to unify the labeling tool with the actions of incentive to the use of cleaner technologies. by 2022 it is expected to have the classification of labeling at the national level and at the district level it is expected to have a pilot of vehicle labeling, later it is expected to update the restrictions on circulation and other programs that can use the levels of environmental label as an instrument of categorization. this will facilitate on-road control and vehicle restriction policies, which are currently defined for private vehicles according to the license plate number, which can be exempted from in-service restrictions if a full fee is paid regardless of the impact on air quality of the technology circulating. for heavy-duty vehicles the current restrictions are carried out according to the load capacity and model year of circulation, and historically from 2019 backwards there was a peak and environmental plate of one hour a day according to the plate. over time, it is sought that the number of vehicles with zero and low emission labels increase in the city, as well as that the labels with associated levels of higher emissions are reduced, thus achieving a decrease in total emissions by the vehicle fleet that circulates in the city.

title: financing for the fund for the renewal of taxis to electric vehicles.
desc: the city of bogotá has a pilot of 43 individual public transport vehicles - electric taxis adopted by district decree 677 of 2011, which has been developed since 2013. as a result, in 2019 the district secretariat of mobility carried out the dim-t-008-2019 study on the evaluation of this pilot. it was found that through this pilot, 43 electric taxis have traveled more than 10 million kilometers and it has been possible to avoid the emission of approximately 3,350 tons of co2 and 40 kg of particulate matter, demonstrating multiple environmental benefits, however, it is a fact that at present, the initial investment cost of electric taxis is higher than one of conventional fuel,  therefore, financing mechanisms are needed through which resources can be leveraged to benefit taxi owners who are interested in renewing their vehicle for a zero-emission one. it is necessary to bear in mind that the massification of this fleet will generate other benefits such as strengthening the economic cluster around vehicles with this type of engine (recharging infrastructure, spare parts, workshop services, washing etc.), after-sales services that are very localized today prevent maintenance costs from being reduced.

title: financing for the tricycle and tricimobile renovation fund for passenger transport.
desc: the passenger transport service in tricycles and tricimoviles, has been provided in the city of bogotá as an informal service, mainly in areas of last kilometer for connection with the public transport system with approximately 4,616 vehicles, of which it is estimated that 51% are combustion (source: census 2019, sdm). on the other hand, the ministry of transport through resolution 3256 of 2018, regulated and authorized the provision of the public passenger transport service in tricycles or non-motorized tricimobiles and tricimobiles with pedal assist in areas of first and last kilometer of transport systems, special treatment areas and tourism; the district secretariat of mobility has been carrying out different activities to carry out this formalization of the service, among them, the study of technical, legal and financial structuring, requested by the ministry. however, for the operation of this service it is necessary to make the technological change of the vehicles that currently circulate, for those that meet the requirements indicated by the ministry of transport, and therefore it is necessary to find economic resources that allow current operators, options for the financing of these new vehicles.

title: district fund for the promotion of the technological ascent of cargo transport
desc: reduce emissions of particulate matter and greenhouse gases, through the technological management of vehicles and the social strengthening of owners and drivers of urban cargo transport in the capital region.urban cargo transport vehicles represent a challenge in pollution, climate change, energy efficiency, traffic, competitiveness, road safety, among others. diagnosis: 96,000 cargo vehicles circulating in bogotá in a business day70% are from small owners of cargo vehicles81% of euro i and ii technologyrepresent 16% of total pm2.5 emissions and more than 10% ghgthe goal is to modernize 67,000 urban cargo transport vehicles in bogotá. the total cost has not yet been estimated. the seed capital of the public sector is 7,000 million cop pesos contributed by the ministry of environment and the secretariat of mobility of bogotá.
title+desc: district fund for the promotion of the technological ascent of cargo transport. reduce emissions of particulate matter and greenhouse gases, through the technological management of vehicles and the social strengthening of owners and drivers of urban cargo transport in the capital region.urban cargo transport vehicles represent a challenge in pollution, climate change, energy efficiency, traffic, competitiveness, road safety, among others. diagnosis: 96,000 cargo vehicles circulating in bogotá in a business day70% are from small owners of cargo vehicles81% of euro i and ii technologyrepresent 16% of total pm2.5 emissions and more than 10% ghgthe goal is to modernize 67,000 urban cargo transport vehicles in bogotá. the total cost has not yet been estimated. the seed capital of the public sector is 7,000 million cop pesos contributed by the ministry of environment and the secretariat of mobility of bogotá.

title: sustainable driving program for bogotá
desc: poor driving practices of a motor vehicle affect its energy efficiency. it has been shown that high idle times, accelerations and sudden braking, engine operation at high revolutions per minute (rpm), use of accessories such as air conditioning, poor technical-mechanical condition; they are directly related to fuel consumption and its associated atmospheric emissions. thus, in recent years, the concept of sustainable driving has emerged, as a short-term strategy, through which it seeks to reduce the energy consumption of vehicles, as well as reduce the risk of accidents and reduce costs in the operation of vehicles. therefore, it has been considered to implement a sustainable driving program that maximizes the benefits in air quality, road safety and economic, by the drivers of the city
title+desc: sustainable driving program for bogotá. poor driving practices of a motor vehicle affect its energy efficiency. it has been shown that high idle times, accelerations and sudden braking, engine operation at high revolutions per minute (rpm), use of accessories such as air conditioning, poor technical-mechanical condition; they are directly related to fuel consumption and its associated atmospheric emissions. thus, in recent years, the concept of sustainable driving has emerged, as a short-term strategy, through which it seeks to reduce the energy consumption of vehicles, as well as reduce the risk of accidents and reduce costs in the operation of vehicles. therefore, it has been considered to implement a sustainable driving program that maximizes the benefits in air quality, road safety and economic, by the drivers of the city

title: environmental monitoring and control of new and in-use vehicular technologies under updated measurement methods
desc: currently, multiple in-service vehicle technologies are available that have rendered conventional gas measurement methods obsolete because emissions are even lower than the detection limits of current equipment and measurement methods, corresponding to constant speed measurements without load and idle for gasoline vehicles and free acceleration tests for opacity measurement. that is the case of diesel vehicles with particulate matter emission control systems such as diesel particulate filters or selective catalytic reduction systems for nitrogen oxides, and in gasoline vehicles of indirect injection the conventional three-way catalysts and for those with direct injection systems some have gasoline particulate filters. that under the current methods it is not possible to identify the vehicular environmental status and does not allow to establish the emissions under normal operating conditionson the other hand, from the ministry of environment and sustainable development is in update the norm that establishes the new emission limits to migrate to euro 6 and vi in light and heavy diesel vehicles respectively,  as well as promotion to euro 4 in gasoline vehicles and currently euro 3 in motorcycles. therefore, it is intended to carry out an update of the measurement methods in order to establish the compliance status and the update of the emission limits for the multiple technologies available in the city. for this, it is contemplated to carry out:- implementation of the control by means of the counting of the number of particles in diesel vehicles.- formulation of the monitoring and environmental characterization by means of dynamic tests to vehicles in use and inclusion of nox control.- support in the formulation of the control program by obd directed by the ministry of environment
title+desc: environmental monitoring and control of new and in-use vehicular technologies under updated measurement methods. currently, multiple in-service vehicle technologies are available that have rendered conventional gas measurement methods obsolete because emissions are even lower than the detection limits of current equipment and measurement methods, corresponding to constant speed measurements without load and idle for gasoline vehicles and free acceleration tests for opacity measurement. that is the case of diesel vehicles with particulate matter emission control systems such as diesel particulate filters or selective catalytic reduction systems for nitrogen oxides, and in gasoline vehicles of indirect injection the conventional three-way catalysts and for those with direct injection systems some have gasoline particulate filters. that under the current methods it is not possible to identify the vehicular environmental status and does not allow to establish the emissions under normal operating conditionson the other hand, from the ministry of environment and sustainable development is in update the norm that establishes the new emission limits to migrate to euro 6 and vi in light and heavy diesel vehicles respectively,  as well as promotion to euro 4 in gasoline vehicles and currently euro 3 in motorcycles. therefore, it is intended to carry out an update of the measurement methods in order to establish the compliance status and the update of the emission limits for the multiple technologies available in the city. for this, it is contemplated to carry out:- implementation of the control by means of the counting of the number of particles in diesel vehicles.- formulation of the monitoring and environmental characterization by means of dynamic tests to vehicles in use and inclusion of nox control.- support in the formulation of the control program by obd directed by the ministry of environment

title: ecozones for life
desc: an ecozone is a project that seeks to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve the conditions of adaptation to climate change through 1) an educational and awareness process and 2) low-cost and high-impact interventions; both built collectively with the community, in 5 components: sustainable mobility, improvement of habitat and public space, urban agriculture and forestry, renewable energy, and integrated waste management. in addition to reducing ghg emissions in the intervened area, it seeks to privilege the quality of life of citizens by improving air quality, public space, safety, sustainable transport, food security, balance with the environment and the construction of social fabric; based on the role of the citizen as part of the solution to mitigate and adapt to climate change. the sum of several ecozones can contribute to the construction of a low-carbon neighborhood, the sum of low-carbon neighborhoods can contribute to the construction of a low-carbon city, the sum of low-carbon cities, builds a low-carbon metropolis.

title: improvement of energy efficiency and alternative energies in public facilities in the municipality of envigado
desc: it is proposed the installation of 5 photovoltaic systems in public facilities: 3 environmental parks, a citizen meeting center and an administrative headquarters
title+desc: improvement of energy efficiency and alternative energies in public facilities in the municipality of envigado. it is proposed the installation of 5 photovoltaic systems in public facilities: 3 environmental parks, a citizen meeting center and an administrative headquarters

title: energy efficiency in infrastructure and public buildings
desc: in this measure, it is sought that the infrastructure works belonging, financed or promoted by the public sector comply with sustainability criteria, both for existing buildings through the improvement of infrastructure and equipment, and in new infrastructure through requirements in the construction parameters. this also includes the promotion of thermal districts and the development of sustainable street lighting. additionally, in the development plan, itagüí city of opportunities 2020-2023, in its strategic line 18 "management of household public services", program 62 "modernization of public lighting for a city of opportunities", the modernization of the public lighting system was defined, moving from the traditional system to the led system; with a goal of modernizing a total of 6,800 luminaires in the four-year period, which will allow the municipal administration to save 12,000,000 kwh at the end of the project in 2024. as for energy consumption, the goal is to go from 7,825,000 kwh (2019) to 5,325,000 kwh (2023). program 63. modernization of public lighting for a city of opportunities.
title+desc: energy efficiency in infrastructure and public buildings. in this measure, it is sought that the infrastructure works belonging, financed or promoted by the public sector comply with sustainability criteria, both for existing buildings through the improvement of infrastructure and equipment, and in new infrastructure through requirements in the construction parameters. this also includes the promotion of thermal districts and the development of sustainable street lighting. additionally, in the development plan, itagüí city of opportunities 2020-2023, in its strategic line 18 "management of household public services", program 62 "modernization of public lighting for a city of opportunities", the modernization of the public lighting system was defined, moving from the traditional system to the led system; with a goal of modernizing a total of 6,800 luminaires in the four-year period, which will allow the municipal administration to save 12,000,000 kwh at the end of the project in 2024. as for energy consumption, the goal is to go from 7,825,000 kwh (2019) to 5,325,000 kwh (2023). program 63. modernization of public lighting for a city of opportunities.

title: implement waste reduction, use and recovery schemes
desc: the measure proposes actions focused on optimizing the management of organic and recyclable solid waste in the municipality of itagüí, with waste separation activities at the source of generation. specifically, it seeks to formalize recyclers, carry out composting campaigns and promote initiatives to recover paper and cardboard waste to create and improve the scales of use, recycling and valorization of these. the measure will be implemented in coordination with the amva and the companies providing public services. in the development plan 2020 – 2023, itagüí city of opportunities, program 66 is proposed "use of organic and inorganic waste in the urban and / or rural area of the city" which has as its result goal the "increase to 12% of the use of solid waste", a goal that was also included in this ipcc.
title+desc: implement waste reduction, use and recovery schemes. the measure proposes actions focused on optimizing the management of organic and recyclable solid waste in the municipality of itagüí, with waste separation activities at the source of generation. specifically, it seeks to formalize recyclers, carry out composting campaigns and promote initiatives to recover paper and cardboard waste to create and improve the scales of use, recycling and valorization of these. the measure will be implemented in coordination with the amva and the companies providing public services. in the development plan 2020 – 2023, itagüí city of opportunities, program 66 is proposed "use of organic and inorganic waste in the urban and / or rural area of the city" which has as its result goal the "increase to 12% of the use of solid waste", a goal that was also included in this ipcc.

title: active and alternative mobility
desc: this measure implements actions to improve and increase the road infrastructure for active mobility through the implementation of the metropolitan bicycle master plan, encouraging the use of alternative modes of transport (bicycle, skateboard, etc.), increasing and optimizing the coverage and use of the public transport system, and thus reducing ghg emissions. on the other hand, the development plan 2020-2023, itagüí city of opportunities, proposes to increase urban public spaces, there it is defined that in the municipality there are currently 6.8 km of bicycle routes and an opportunity to add 2.8km is identified. this plan proposed a goal of building 1.4 km of bicycle routes by 2023.likewise, pigeca (amva, 2017) contemplates a thematic axis 4 called "transforming the mobility model towards the promotion and prioritization of active and low-emission modes of transport" which includes measures related to policies and programs to improve walking conditions,  expand and connect the bicycle infrastructure network, improve equipment for active mobility, among others; which it is recommended to consult once this measure of the picc-itagüí is going to be executed.
title+desc: active and alternative mobility. this measure implements actions to improve and increase the road infrastructure for active mobility through the implementation of the metropolitan bicycle master plan, encouraging the use of alternative modes of transport (bicycle, skateboard, etc.), increasing and optimizing the coverage and use of the public transport system, and thus reducing ghg emissions. on the other hand, the development plan 2020-2023, itagüí city of opportunities, proposes to increase urban public spaces, there it is defined that in the municipality there are currently 6.8 km of bicycle routes and an opportunity to add 2.8km is identified. this plan proposed a goal of building 1.4 km of bicycle routes by 2023.likewise, pigeca (amva, 2017) contemplates a thematic axis 4 called "transforming the mobility model towards the promotion and prioritization of active and low-emission modes of transport" which includes measures related to policies and programs to improve walking conditions,  expand and connect the bicycle infrastructure network, improve equipment for active mobility, among others; which it is recommended to consult once this measure of the picc-itagüí is going to be executed.

title: promote energy efficiency and renewable energy at the residential and commercial level
desc: the measure consists of developing actions focused on encouraging energy efficiency through the installation of more efficient technologies and the generation of renewable energies for domestic consumption. also, heating methods that use non-polluting sources of energy. on the other hand, it also promotes energy efficiency and the rational use of energy in homes, such as efficient stoves or efficient cooking systems in rural areas of the municipality. the actions will be coordinated with the companies providing public services and the energy and gas regulatory commission (creg).
title+desc: promote energy efficiency and renewable energy at the residential and commercial level. the measure consists of developing actions focused on encouraging energy efficiency through the installation of more efficient technologies and the generation of renewable energies for domestic consumption. also, heating methods that use non-polluting sources of energy. on the other hand, it also promotes energy efficiency and the rational use of energy in homes, such as efficient stoves or efficient cooking systems in rural areas of the municipality. the actions will be coordinated with the companies providing public services and the energy and gas regulatory commission (creg).

title: urban forestry and urban and population centre forest parks
desc: green areas and urban trees are crucial in the management of sustainable cities because they make them safer by reducing the impacts of storms and climate change; also to improve air quality and make cities more pleasant by providing places for recreation and encounter (amva, 2017). itagüí is one of the most densely populated municipalities in colombia. with 253,000 inhabitants, scarcely distributed in 17 square kilometers, of which 12 correspond to the urban area. "that is to say that there are 14 inhabitants for every square meter." of the remaining 5 kilometers, 4 correspond to the manzanillo peak, the only green lung of itagüí.the objective of the secretariat of infrastructure, is to enable the development and conservation of physical infrastructure for public use, road infrastructure, parks, green areas, public spaces and the constructions of the municipality of itagüí, controlling the quality of its execution,  the maintenance of the optimal conditions of use and the preservation of the diversity and integrity of the environment to enable the integral development of productive economic activities, through the study, design, construction, conservation and supervision of civil works (itagüí, n.d.). for this, in the development plan 2020-2023, itagüí city of opportunities, programs 78 "conservation of the tree component and urban green areas and population centers" and 79 "conservation of the landscape component and plant layers in the urban area and population centers" are proposed, with which it is proposed to increase to 30,000 the number of trees evaluated and in maintenance by the municipal administration,  as well as 15,000 the number of trees reforested in ecosystems and areas of environmental importance. likewise, the pigeca (amva, 2017), in its thematic axis 6 "increase of green spaces and urban trees and protection of regional ecosystems", defines measures for the protection and expansion of urban trees; green public space, green corridors and green belt, among others; which must be considered for the implementation of this cicc-itagüí measure.

title: nama dots for perpetual relief, economic and creative district of medellín
desc: urban planning and intervention initiative with mitigation criteria aimed at the development of transport (nama tod).  the nama dots initiative for perpetual relief, economic and creative district of medellín, seeks to contribute to the construction of a compact city and generate environmental and urban conditions that promote habitat and human well-being. in addition, the area to be intervened, as a district, seeks to promote the development of the creative and low-carbon economy for the city. the pre-feasibility analysis was developed in order to conceptually, functionally and spatially, design the structure of the public open space of perpetual help, enhancing its dna condition (orange development area), through the development of concrete projects in the public sphere that allow the transformation of this future ecodistrict into a well-connected destination,  with sustainable, biodiverse, dense and highly mixed mobility, which becomes an urban, cultural and creative place, ideal for living, working and recreation, contributing to the national strategy of low-carbon development. the perpetuo socorre neighborhood, where this project will be developed, has been populated by companies that recognize this potential in it and have begun to turn it into a creative territory, giving it transformative leadership and entrepreneurial spirit which has made it the guarantor of its recognition and appointment as an economic and creative district of perpetual relief and orange development area (adn- the first in the country),  proposing it as the epicenter of the creative ecosystem of medellín.the perpetual help project is that it be recognized as a collective space that promotes human mobility and neighborhood dynamics around public space. inhabitants, users and visitors will be able to enjoy the space between traditional uses and new creative uses. this will be possible by mixing services, shops and housing at walkable distances and connected to the diversity of the collective mobility system. the project for the district, then, consists of a set of interventions on the open public space focused on prioritizing pedestrian mobility, cycling and the reintegration of nature. accompanied by other complementary interventions aimed at promoting the arrival of initiatives and talents and integration with mobility. in this transversal, integral initiative, which envisions a total transformation on perpetual help, priority has been given to bets that coincide with the strategies prioritized by the partial plan, with accompanying the existing initiatives of the neighborhood and with the vision of reconnecting the ecological network, articulating the stations of the collective transport systems,  bike routes, bike parks, equipment and pre-existing public spaces in a mix, which promises to be the catalyst recipe for the transformation necessary for an example of a more sustainable city, with much less emissions, a significant reduction in the carbon footprint while being sufficiently mixed and compact to attract businesses, talents and inhabitants.

title: plant for energy and material use through the treatment of organic waste in the city of medellín
desc: the project aims to develop a plant for waste management through the energy use of waste and gases generated in the la pradera landfill, a final waste disposal site in the region. it is currently in the pre-feasibility stage, therefore the process begins with the following activities:identification, evaluation, management and analysis for the selection of properties studies of the selected property and designs for the implementation of the exploitation system in the pre-feasibility phase (evaluation and definition)commercial, financial and tariff analysis of the exploitation plantdefinitial designs in the feasibility phase of the selected alternative (25 years). given this situation, there is still no estimate of the necessary investment values, pending pre-feasibility studies.

title: north river parks
desc: the project is in the stage of designs and property management and has as a goal in the current administration 2020-2023 – medellín future, to realize 300,000 m2 of public space and finish 100% the stage 1 parque del norte built (quebrada la seca, to the villa del socorro ravine), which will be delivered to the community in 2023.parques del rio norte is a strategic project of the mayor's office of medellín that aims to the human and collective development of the inhabitants of the municipality, through the generation of green and sustainable public space for recreation and recreation in the north zone of the city.currently, the municipality of medellín recognizes that it has a deficit in terms of the rate of effective public space per inhabitant, which is 3.64 square meters compared to the 15 suggested by the who,  being the north of the city, specifically the northeastern area the one that presents the greatest deficit of public space in medellín, so it is necessary to propose a project that contributes to the increase of this rate, taking into account that the effective public space is the place for the meeting and daily citizen congregation in which relationships of various kinds are established,  so the behavior of the individuals of a city is defined in many ways, therefore, parques del rio norte will contribute as a main project of creation and quality public space and will integrate roads, bicycle routes, and connection to the national axis of the medellín-bogotá highway, with criteria of sustainability, innovation and social balance. likewise, the generation of public space through the north river parks project contributes to mitigating the effects of climate change in the city and it is expected that from its execution, it will improve the capacity of territorial adaptation to heat and extreme precipitation, through the implementation of solutions based on nature,  in accordance with the guidelines of the renaturalization plan for medellín, under the sustainability criteria. general objectiveincrement the index of public space per inhabitant, through the improvement of urban conditions in sectors with spontaneous and deficient urban development. the project participates in the finance facility program of c4o cities, through which it is expected to mature the initiative for financing.  https://www.c40cff.org/

title: institutional strengthening for sustainable and conscious mobility
desc: the existing problems in the municipality of sabaneta, specifically around mobility, are presented by different factors, such as the proliferation of new homes that generate an overpopulation with respect to the existing road infrastructure, also the fact that there is a partial lack of education and culture on the part of the different road actors,  in relation to traffic signs and the requirement of traffic agents. the increase in the circulation of vehicles due to the different leisure activities that are carried out in the municipality, cause greater vehicular congestion on the main roads for what is required, the improvement of the alternative road infrastructure, mitigating road insecurity for drivers, cyclists, pedestrians and visitors to the town.
title+desc: institutional strengthening for sustainable and conscious mobility. the existing problems in the municipality of sabaneta, specifically around mobility, are presented by different factors, such as the proliferation of new homes that generate an overpopulation with respect to the existing road infrastructure, also the fact that there is a partial lack of education and culture on the part of the different road actors,  in relation to traffic signs and the requirement of traffic agents. the increase in the circulation of vehicles due to the different leisure activities that are carried out in the municipality, cause greater vehicular congestion on the main roads for what is required, the improvement of the alternative road infrastructure, mitigating road insecurity for drivers, cyclists, pedestrians and visitors to the town.

title: integral management of solid waste in the municipality
desc: strengthen environmental education strategies aimed at the community on the different existing alternatives to manage, recover and take advantage of solid waste, through a program carried out by the mayor's office of the municipality of sabaneta. this alternative allows to advance programs that strengthen the environmental culture and finally promote the care of natural resources. likewise, a training plan and the deployment and maintenance of the integral solid waste management plan are contemplated as a norm and roadmap to follow.
title+desc: integral management of solid waste in the municipality. strengthen environmental education strategies aimed at the community on the different existing alternatives to manage, recover and take advantage of solid waste, through a program carried out by the mayor's office of the municipality of sabaneta. this alternative allows to advance programs that strengthen the environmental culture and finally promote the care of natural resources. likewise, a training plan and the deployment and maintenance of the integral solid waste management plan are contemplated as a norm and roadmap to follow.

title: measures to address climate change in the municipality of sabaneta, antioquia
desc: formulate and implement strategies for mitigation and adaptation to climate change; through the configuration of an action plan articulated with the tools of the environmental authority and departmental instruments, which will reduce the environmental impacts generated by anthropic activities. defined from activities of recovery and conservation of areas that provide strategic ecosystem services with the formulation of projects that allow sensitizing the community in the rational use of natural resources and the execution of infrastructure works for the mitigation of risks, this would improve the quality of life of the inhabitants of sabaneteños and reduce the problems that affect the population.
title+desc: measures to address climate change in the municipality of sabaneta, antioquia. formulate and implement strategies for mitigation and adaptation to climate change; through the configuration of an action plan articulated with the tools of the environmental authority and departmental instruments, which will reduce the environmental impacts generated by anthropic activities. defined from activities of recovery and conservation of areas that provide strategic ecosystem services with the formulation of projects that allow sensitizing the community in the rational use of natural resources and the execution of infrastructure works for the mitigation of risks, this would improve the quality of life of the inhabitants of sabaneteños and reduce the problems that affect the population.

title: improving air quality and controlling noise
desc: consolidation of actions focused on improving air quality indices that are generated mainly by fixed sources and prevention of the impact of noise on the generation of environmental pollution; among which are operations and campaigns in fixed and operational sources and campaigns in commercial establishments that generate noise.
title+desc: improving air quality and controlling noise. consolidation of actions focused on improving air quality indices that are generated mainly by fixed sources and prevention of the impact of noise on the generation of environmental pollution; among which are operations and campaigns in fixed and operational sources and campaigns in commercial establishments that generate noise.

title: practices that contribute to sustainable urbanism
desc: this project contains three specific actions with which it is intended to contribute to the creation of practices that are aimed at sustainable urbanism. initially there will be a review and subsequent call to generate gardens in homes where families tend to advance in the strengthening of environmental culture and in the creation of places to have a healthy diet, later technical accompaniments and advice will be made in the different processes of planting, growth and harvesting. the second action refers to a process with companies in order to strengthen circular economy and sustainability processes, bearing in mind the importance of generating processes that contribute to environmental culture from organizations. finally, the intervention of green areas will be carried out permanently in each of the sites that merit it with the operational staff of the secretariat. for each of the actions in question, resources will be managed with departmental level entities in order to enhance each of these activities that contribute to the implementation of the project.

title: protection of water resources
desc: this project contains five specific actions with which it is intended to link the tools of water resource management and actions by the municipality, aimed at the protection of basins and tributaries through mechanisms of cleaning and increasing forest cover in the areas of influence of the micro-basins. likewise, they seek to establish links, scenarios and resources for the accompaniment of the veredales aqueducts, within the framework of the municipal water plan updated for the year 2017. finally, there is a strengthening and /or implementation of environmental management plans for watersheds, where these elements link the actions of the environmental authorities (metropolitan area of the aburrá valley and corantioquia) and the responsibilities of the municipal administration in securing the resource, its management and police actions against possible inappropriate uses of it.

title: clean air program
desc: the maximum aspiration of this program is to serve as a starting point for a collective dialogue where actions to improve air quality become an element to promote the development of the city, ensuring environmentally sustainable social growth that guarantees prosperity and equality for all.

title: strengthen la tilichera (a barter, repair, supra-recycling, training and education center) to meet the needs of women and their families and reduce waste in monteverde, costa rica
desc: this project will address the problem of the linear economy that wastes resources, pollutes the environment, overproduces garbage and generates profits in an unequal way, especially in terms of women. expected results:• supply at least 1000 women and their families with basic items through barter and donations. • generate employment for at least 15 women and increase sales of at least 20 entrepreneurs for the production and sale of supra-recycled items and repair of others and at the same time make the truque center economically sustainable and a replicable model in other communities.• train on the circular economy and supra-recycling to 10 collaborators of la tilichera,  20 entrepreneurs and 30 women from the community.• sensitize the population of 6000 people in the monteverde area and the 50,000 followers of zona alta medios about the circular economy, how to reduce garbage and take advantage of resources, through 3 videos, social networks, other media and monthly dynamic activities for young people.

title: new tools for financing climate action: creating a blended finance portfolio that stimulates public-private investment in climate action
desc: main activities of the projectspecific objective 1: encourage productive climate actions in the private sector by creating incubation routes for ventures and direct financing options when they demonstrate a clear capacity to generate socio-environmental benefits and financial returns. task 1.1. establish a scholarship fund (fondo emprendedores; non-reimbursable resources) that supports local social entrepreneurs to participate in certified incubation programs at the national level. (year 1) task 1.2 map the network of nationally certified incubators and foster relationships with related institutions to raise awareness of the diversity of specialties and resources available (e.g., rural, technological, women, youth, etc.) enterprises. (year 1) task 1.3. structure and feed a "extinguishable" prototype fund focused on the pre-investment stage for well-conceptualized ventures ("pre-investment fund"; non-reimbursable resources) so that they can be "bankable" more quickly. (year 1) task 1.4. establish a fund belonging to the fcm (direct investment fund; investment capital) to invest in bankable initiatives in order to generate socio-environmental benefits and renewable income that cover operating expenses. this fund also applies to public-private partnership initiatives and to attract parallel investments. (year 2) specific objective 2: stimulate greater public and mixed investments in priority social good initiatives by adding new financial tools related to community philanthropy that help to overcome the pre-investment and financing stages faster. task 2.1. structure and implement a special campaign model that seeks to raise significant philanthropic counterparts capable of leveraging more non-reimbursable public sector funds to fund pre-investment designs and/or studies. (year 1) this same strategy can be used to finish capitalizing the new direct investment fund during year 3. apart from enhancing large socio-environmental impacts, a focus on ppp initiatives presents future opportunities to invest a portion of the direct investment fund in initiatives with greater scale and lower risk. task 2.2. conduct a feasibility study on the establishment, capitalization and management of special legal vehicles (e.g., bnv sustainable bonds, securitization trust, etc.) for the financing of public initiatives through social impact investments from the local, national and international private sector. (year 2) specific objective 3: invest in the training of staff, managers and local allies, as well as new technologies in order to strengthen the implementation of existing fcm programs and new strategies proposed for the next 3 years. task3.1. carry out a series of talking about the management of ppps, social impact investments and micro-credit companies. task 3.2 conduct a regional market study that identifies with greater specificity the existing perspectives on credit, in addition to estimating growth potential, specific gaps (i.e., loan guarantees, access to direct loans with competitive rates, or the desire for autonomy and lower transaction costs), potential local competitors (or allies),  and the specific profile (guild, geography, demographics) of those who really want it. (year 2) task 3.3. conduct a market study to identify project financial management systems (e.g., sicap and odoo) that can reduce expenses and save time in the management/control of sub-donations. (year 1)

title: moving visitors, neighbors and the economy in monteverde: integrating safe and sustainable transport with intermodal hubs
desc: general objective: to strengthen and promote accessible and safe mobility that allows the movement of locals and tourists to their destinations from an intermodal system that links different means including collective and electric transport and active mobility. specific objectives:-reduce the number of cars transporting a single person and thus also reduce the carbon footprint caused by the combustion of cars-increase the percentage of people with access to safe and sustainable mobility, implementing a gender approach and populations with fewer resources. - implement collective transport models that can be replicated in other districts-adapt and create inter-modal stations in which tourists and locals can exchange means of transport to meet their needs and tastes. -potentiate economic activity due to the increase in the flow of customers in businesses near the stations, provide transport alternatives within the reach of the user, distribute benefits in the most rural areas and increase employment to carriers.-facilitate the implementation of practices that guarantee safe means of transport for users and drivers. -improve the image of monteverde as a model of sustainability by reducing its greenhouse gas emissions and vehicle congestion. this project will integrate and promote an accessible, safe and sustainable transport system with different modes of mobility integrating intermodal nuclei. each station will allow travelers to reach a place with shops, services or attractions with the possibility of changing from one means of transport to another. the project has four main components:1. prototype different modes of collective transport in the monteverde area for neighbors, visitors in 5 categories: (1) know schedules, systems and payment and information about collective transport on the main route in the area from the monteverde cloud forest reserve to the santa elena cloud forest reserve, (2) create whatsapp groups for which like-minded people can request and organize shared rides,  (3) collective mobility for employees of companies, (4) collective transport for students in private educational centers and (5) collective transport from monteverde to other destinations in the country., all these under will be the context of an intermodal mobility system. 2. adapt and install intermodal transport hubs to link pedestrian, cyclist, shared and electric transport3. consolidate and publish information and clean mobility options under a visible and accessible system.4.  establish an association of users who can request collective transport through an application and / or central office. 5. promote the use of the system to national and international visitors and local visitors.

title: electric routes costa rica
desc: the rutas eléctricas costa rica project seeks to create a network of charging points for electric vehicles in the shops of different communities throughout the national territory. an electric route is defined as a support network so that people who want to visit a destination in an electric car can have not only enough charging points along the way, but when they arrive in the community. charging points are located in restaurants, hotels, attractions and other businesses where drivers want to spend time. users will be able to charge their vehicles while resting, eating, shopping and running errands and/or enjoying the tourist attractions in the area. to date, electric routes have been launched in four communities and there are six more communities at different stages of organization.  it is expected to establish a total of 30 communities friendly to electric vehicles before the end of 2025.the costa rica electric routes would offer companies, communities and the country in general, an element of differentiation to stand out in the national market and ecotourism and accelerate the adoption of electric mobility.

title: implementation of actions that allow the composting of biodegradable waste produced in the canton and process them in the same facilities, creating by-products for gardening.
desc: this project aims to reduce the amount of organic waste sent to the landfill and consequently reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the disposal of that waste. the local government has implemented since 2019 the composting project at home by delivering homemade rotating compost bins. for the execution of this project there is a contract with the company 360 soluciones verdes.this project has provided local treatment to domestic organic waste, avoiding the sending of organic waste to the east landfill, seeks to give local treatment to garden waste generated by the cleaning of parks and public spaces in the canton.

title: boulevard of the guaycanes
desc: the project consists of the creation of a pedestrian boulevard within the canton of cañas, which will facilitate urban mobilization to more ecological means of transport, such as bicycles or walks through the city

title: training and empowerment of citizens and institutions, through environmental education, specifically on the proper management of organic solid waste
desc: the municipality of cañas has environmental goals focused on carrying out initiatives that favor the integral management of solid waste in the canton, with efforts based on separation at source, including both recoverable and organic. this project aims to create a community trained, empower and efficient in the correct management of organic waste, which is generated within their homes, which in turn brings benefits to the institution from the reduction of operating costs and payment of carbon offsets; as well as it will be possible to assess the decrease in the rate for the disposal of solid waste that users pay to the municipality.

title: inter-municipal project for waste management: towards a circular economy
desc: the project aims to transform solid waste management through the good practices of the circular economy model, in accordance with law 8839 and thus contributing to the ghg reduction of the five local governments: curridabat, desamparados, la unión, montes deoca and san josé, which will be united in a commonwealth called komūnitas. it is currently working on forming a commonwealth, under the legal figure of a public company with public funds, which will be responsible for managing the financing and execution of the project.

title: continuity of boulevards
desc: central avenue boulevard extension: extend the central avenue boulevard from 11th street to 19th street for the expansion of pedestrian spaces in the improvement of pedestrian mobility (cost: 950,000,000 colones). boulevard calle 2: connect the central avenue with the station to the pacific for the promotion of pedestrian and cyclist mobility and the economic strengthening of the south of the city (cost not yet defined). inter-institutional coordination: mopt, aqueducts and sewers aya, costa rican electricity institute ice, national company of force and light cnfl, commerce, property owners, in relation to the execution and progress of work.

title: develop an integral management of solid waste with environmental, social and economic criteria, as well as increase its valorization
desc: (1) strengthening and extension of selective collection in the canton, accompanied by a communication, education and awareness campaign on waste management.  (2) construction and operation of a municipal complex for the storage of recoverable waste collected classified. this complex or plant will include operations to treat separated waste, and will allow to provide especially some method of recovery to organic waste on a larger scale.  funding is pending, so no data on the cost of the project is yet available.

title: sidewalk improvement, accessibility promotion, road safety
desc: road improvement: adapt the roads of san josé and its elements (widths and quality of road surface, sidewalk, pipe cord, green stripes, ramps, signage, etc.) to the safety standards, organization and accessibility of pedestrian and vehicular traffic. enabling zones 30: implement a sustainable urban center strategy between the residential, commercial, gastronomic and community sectors, in the escalante neighborhood for the reconversion of public space.  this seeks that the roads have a vehicular speed restriction of 30km / h.  improvement of sidewalks and road safety: adapt the roads and their elements (widths and quality of road surface, sidewalk, pipe cord, green stripes, ramps, signage, etc.) to the safety standards, organization and accessibility of pedestrian and vehicular traffic.  (cost: 120 000 000 colones) mobility regulations: update the regulations of the urban master plan for the fulfillment of the objectives of the organization.  collaborative work with different dependencies in multidisciplinary commissions, by theme, experience and specialty.

title: public bicycle system (sbp)
desc: facilitate the implementation of an electric-assisted bicycle loan service to encourage the urban use of the bicycle in short-distance and long-term trips, between previously registered and identified people. monitoring: collect information obtained from the application of the use of the pbs for the monitoring of data and its future planning according to the profile of the users. give traceability to the routes of people who travel by bicycle and who use bike parks for the development of new infrastructure. transitory law 9660, regulation bicycle rental system canton of san josé: establish a regulation for the regulation and implementation of law 9660 in compliance with transitory ii.expand the cycling infrastructure network for the safe mobilization of people in the west-east direction of the current bike path with the north-south, as well as the points of interest for the promotion of intermodality.

title: guangarcucho treatment plant.
desc: the guangarcucho wastewater treatment plant will treat cuenca wastewater with a capacity of 1,200 liters per second (l/s) equivalent to 40% of what is generated in cuenca, which consists of a primary sedimentation section with three tanks with three tanks of 35 meters (m) in diameter and four deep, these will be equipped with auxiliary units that will allow the handling of foams and sedimented sludge. it will treat 1,200 liters per second (l / s) and double as maximum hourly flow. this is equivalent to 40% of what is generated in cuenca, with a population of 590,000 inhabitants.

title: carbon footprint offset scheme
desc: forests, compensation and avoided deforestation. the ministry of environment of the dmq is working on a carbon footprint offset mechanism (greenhouse gas emissions), through a pilot. this project seeks to implement local sustainability actions with a possible reduction of the carbon footprint, which will be financed with resources from territorial actors interested in offsetting their emissions that are no longer feasible to reduce, in the context of their sustainability policies. one of the compensation options is precisely to maintain and manage forest areas where avoided deforestation is guaranteed.

title: electricity generation from biogas.
desc: generation of electricity with biogas from the quito landfill. this project consists of the use of biogas from the quito landfill for the generation of electricity, as part of the district's zero waste policy, which promotes the prevention, minimization and separation of waste sources, as well as responsible and efficient collection, treatment and disposal of waste. the metropolitan public solid waste management company (emgirs) is in charge of the quito landfill "el inga", where domestic solid waste collected from the city and 33 rural parishes are deposited since 2003 (approximately 2,000 tons per day, of which 57% is organic waste, 24% is recyclable waste and 19% is rejects). there is a network of pipes to capture biogas within the entire "el inga" landfill, which leads to a chimney where the biogas is incinerated. with an investment of approximately us$7 million, by the end of 2015 there will be a biogas power plant assembled within the "el inga" landfill, starting to generate 2mw/h, and expecting to generate 5mw/h by the end of 2016. the generation of electricity through biogas from the quito landfill contributes to the national grid, as a source of conventional renewable energies, supporting the new national energy matrix. it also mitigates the environmental impact caused by the emission of greenhouse gases, in this case, methane. this action will reduce 144,000 tco2e per year.

title: efficient public lighting
desc: this project consists of the modernization, replacement and expansion of the public lighting system of the metropolitan district of quito (dmq), replacing conventional luminaires (around 223,000) with efficient public lighting, promoting energy efficiency, citizen security, reducing the city's carbon footprint and generating savings for citizens and the municipal government. a total replacement of conventional luminaires could mean halving (0.5%) the contribution of street lighting to quito's carbon footprint. the project promotes energy security, by reducing electricity consumption in street lighting (6% of total electricity consumption in the city; double the regional average), in addition, the installation of led lamps, which have better efficiency rates (conversion of energy into luminous flux) than conventional lamps, improves lighting levels within public space and reduces visual pollution and light waste. due to their physical strength and technology, led lamps have a much longer service life (up to 40 times) than conventional incandescent lamps, and can be recycled. the project improves access to electricity, as the energy saved can be distributed to users who currently do not have access to electricity services in homes, businesses and industries. in addition, a proper lighting design improves light levels, increases the safety and aesthetic appeal of the city for residents and visitors. in cooperation with the national government, the local public electricity company (empresa eléctrica de quito - eeq) and private stakeholders, in recent years the municipality has rehabilitated and optimized public lighting, focusing efforts on the historic center of quito, where 2,940 conventional bulbs have been replaced by efficient lighting systems (led),  with an investment of us $ 3 million, which implies a reduction in consumption equivalent to us $ 128,000 per year, which represents the displacement of 715,000 tco2e. the next step of the project is to replace the ornamental street lighting in quito, located in urban parks and green areas, which means the replacement of 1,756 luminaires concentrated mainly on poles (77%), the floor (17%) and facades (6%), with a budget of approximately us $ 1 million. in addition, all conventional quito rays will be replaced.

title: vindobona wastewater treatment plant
desc: this project proposes to carry out a complete and adequate management of the liquid waste of quito generated by the population (domestic discharges) and productive activities (industrial discharges), through the interception, transport and treatment of the city's wastewater, decontaminating 246 km of quito's rivers and streams, minimizing the impacts that currently derive from direct discharges,  improving the quality of life of the population. the infrastructure consists of the construction of sewer main pipes and secondary marginal collectors, which transport wastewater to water recovery plants. interceptors will be installed, making bad odors disappear, improving air quality and peaceful citizen coexistence near the now polluted rivers. propose to transform the degraded areas of influence of rivers into usable areas for irrigation and hydroelectric energy, as well as green areas for recreation and landscaping, potential ecological correctors for the protection of biodiversity. in addition, the project proposes the generation of renewable electricity through the construction of three hydroelectric plants. in addition to making the project self-sufficient, the electricity generated will shift the sale of excess production (28 mw/h) to the city's or country's electricity distribution system. this will avoid thermoelectric generation, which will generate economic savings by avoiding the use of fossil fuels and at the same time reduce greenhouse gas emissions into the atmosphere. only one water recovery plant has been built in the south of the city, the quitumbe plant, with an investment of 12.5 million dollars.

title: urban household solid waste management plan of the municipality of escuintla
desc: financial aspectsin this chapter, the preliminary cost-benefit analysis (pre-feasibility) of the two validated viable alternatives for the integrated management of waste and solid waste of the municipality of escuintla and its respective administration alternatives is carried out, so that the possible income and costs of the planned technical options can be glimpsed. as indicated above, it is proposed that alternative 1 be developed in the municipality of escuintla on its own, while alternative 2 should be carried out jointly.10.1. alternative 1the investments of this alternative are: (i) for the purchase of waste collection and transport trucks; ii) the construction of the plant for the segregation of organic and inorganic waste and the treatment of organic waste to produce compost, including the acquisition of the land, the conformation of the land, the civil works, including the perimeter wall among others and the machinery and equipment;iii) the adaptation of the land for the excavation of cells, their waterproofing,  leachate lagoon, where inert rejects will be unloaded, including machinery and equipment, that is, having a sanitary filling; title: management plan for urban household solid effects of the municipality of san jose
desc: based on the most appropriate preliminary viable alternative, the present plan for the preliminary management of urban household solid waste of the municipality of san josé was elaborated, which corresponds to product 4 of the consultancy. as indicated above, this management plan has the specific objective of strengthening the capacities in the municipality of san josé for the management of urban household solid waste in order to contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions. therefore, the management plan was built jointly with the municipality of san josé, through the head of ugafom and lamasur, through its manager. as well as the participation of other representatives of the municipality, maga, cocode and court in the two workshops held.

title: wastewater treatment plants
desc: it consists of the implementation of a system of treatment of the wastewater produced in the city of san pedro sula, environmental control and sanitation of the tributaries and rivers receiving the domestic and industrial discharges of the city through the construction of three (3) treatment plants. these treatment plants will be built in 3 strategic points of the city, in the lowest points where the wastewater from the different neighborhoods and neighborhoods of the city can be captured by gravity. in different international forums on the problem of wastewater, criteria have been established where it has been considered that this type of projects due to their size as far as investment is concerned are national projects and not of a local nature, especially in countries such as those of the central american region where the costs for their development pass over the capacities of income or regular indebtedness to which a primary city can access or high school. therefore, its viability is only possible through sources such as: the central government, multilateral banking or international cooperation.

title: green areas and public spaces program
desc: it is fundamental for the city of san pedro sula, to have urban trees and green areas within the urban spot. these help mitigate ghg emissions, in addition to multiple benefits to human comfort: they serve as thermoregulators for high temperatures providing climatic comfort to the inhabitants and improving the urban image of neighborhoods and neighborhoods, in addition to providing shade and resting places for pedestrians. the who recommends a minimum area of 9m² per inhabitant of green areas in urban areas to preserve a good level of quality of life, however, the city of san pedro sula does not have data to determine the area per inhabitant of green area and it is estimated that with the amount of green areas that currently exist,  fails to meet the minimum figure.

title: strengthening of municipal infrastructure for the integral management of solid waste
desc: historically, solid waste management has been one of the most relevant subjects for aipromades lago de chapala, focusing on this issue many of its efforts, mainly in providing municipalities with the equipment and infrastructure necessary for the collection and final disposal of waste. rehabilitation of the landfills of atotonilco el alto and jamay, acquisition of waste collection vehicles for the municipalities of tototlán and poncitlán

title: ecological exchange and ecological collection
desc: promotion of collection of recyclable urban solid waste by the population, companies collect and recycle materials delivering benefits in kind to the population, spreading the culture of recycling, ultimately reducing (as a goal) what is processed to landfills. first stage in the race to zero plan. at this stage it is self-financing with the companies involved and part of the resources of the municipality (human resources and plants in exchange with the participants, mainly)
