title: program of replacement of traditional luminaires by leds in the public lighting of the municipality of celaya, gto. 2018 -2021, as part of the energy consumption reduction program.
desc: the municipal government will replace 34,481 traditional public service luminaires in streets and squares with led energy, helping to reduce energy consumption and promoting care for the environment. the project is expected to end in 2021.results: the progress that is made is that until 2021 a total of 26,927 led luminaires have been installed in various neighborhoods of the city.it is pending for the next municipal administration (new government, manage resources to continue with the change of luminaires.in 2021 the following project was carried out: the project consisted of the acquisition and installation of 85 luminaires: 49 energy luminaires led technology that will be connected to the cfe network and 36 all in one led solar luminaires, in sports and recreational areas of the xochipilli park of the municipality of celaya.general objective and specific objectives of the project:general objective:replace and install solar led luminaires "all in one" and led luminaires connected to the electricity grid of the sections i and ii of the xochipilli park of the municipality of celaya in order to generate a social coexistence, provide a quality service to the citizens who visit the park's facilities and mitigate the problem of climate change by reducing emissions of greenhouse gases and compounds, mostly co2. through this action, a reduction of approximately 53% in annual co2 emissions will be achieved, taking into account that greenhouse gases would no longer be completely emitted by the use of led luminaires connected to the grid will only emit 10.17 tons of co2 instead of 21,676 tons of co2e per year. specific objectives:1.generate lighting through the use of clean energy.2.reduce the problem of insecurity in the area due to the lack of public lighting.3.promote environmental awareness of the problems related to climate change in users and visitors to xochipilli park.4.likewise, a broader security protocol will be implemented. goal or expected final results of the project:installation of 85 led lamps and solar leds ''all in one''.reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by 11.56 tons of co2e per year (of the 21,676 tons emitted by the current 49 lamps). increase in environmental culture on the importance of energy efficiency in terms of climate change mitigation in the population that goes to xochipilli parkimprove public lighting in xochipilli park sections i and ii.indicators:economic savings equivalent to approximately 54.23% of the cost of 20,148 kwh per year.population of users reached.53% approx. reduction in annual co2e emissions by the 49 new luminaires already installed.100% reduction of  co2e emissions from the installation of 36 solar luminaires.useful life of 50,000 hourstotal number and type of direct beneficiaries: directly visitors and users of xochipilli park, section i: 397,954 and in section ii 155,783, with a total annual attendance of 553,737 visitors.

installation of 85 luminaires: 49 energy luminaires led technology that will be connected to the cfe network and 36 all in one led solar luminaires, in sports and recreational areas of the xochipilli park of the municipality of celaya.general objective and specific objectives of the project:general objective:replace and install solar led luminaires "all in one" and led luminaires connected to the electricity grid of the sections i and ii of the xochipilli park of the municipality of celaya in order to generate a social coexistence, provide a quality service to the citizens who visit the park's facilities and mitigate the problem of climate change by reducing emissions of greenhouse gases and compounds, mostly co2. through this action, a reduction of approximately 53% in annual co2 emissions will be achieved, taking into account that greenhouse gases would no longer be completely emitted by the use of led luminaires connected to the grid will only emit 10.17 tons of co2 instead of 21,676 tons of co2e per year. specific objectives:1.generate lighting through the use of clean energy.2.reduce the problem of insecurity in the area due to the lack of public lighting.3.promote environmental awareness of the problems related to climate change in users and visitors to xochipilli park.4.likewise, a broader security protocol will be implemented. goal or expected final results of the project:installation of 85 led lamps and solar leds ''all in one''.reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by 11.56 tons of co2e per year (of the 21,676 tons emitted by the current 49 lamps). increase in environmental culture on the importance of energy efficiency in terms of climate change mitigation in the population that goes to xochipilli parkimprove public lighting in xochipilli park sections i and ii.indicators:economic savings equivalent to approximately 54.23% of the cost of 20,148 kwh per year.population of users reached.53% approx. reduction in annual co2e emissions by the 49 new luminaires already installed.100% reduction of  co2e emissions from the installation of 36 solar luminaires.useful life of 50,000 hourstotal number and type of direct beneficiaries: directly visitors and users of xochipilli park, section i: 397,954 and in section ii 155,783, with a total annual attendance of 553,737 visitors.

title: cerro de la campana bio-cultural park
desc: a public initiative to regenerate the deforested area of “cerro de la campana” hill with xerophile flora (resilient to arid climate) to function as a carbon sink and water damping. this development includes the establishment of a “circular economy centre”, a pilot program in which the species of flora will be employed to produce goods (such as food), composting (to maintain the forest) and ethnobotanical products for bio-cultural preservation. this park also contemplates establishing a low-emission zone, a high mobility network and social engagement attractions (such as an extreme sports facility, trekking and cafés). all of the costs presented are an estimate, the final figures might differ.

title: rain nest pilot program
desc: pilot program rain nest that has been implemented by the government of jalisco for the collection and use of rainwater. the project is carried out in conjunction with the isla urbana organization and consists of installing a liquid collection and storage system. in a first stage, the program will reach 600 homes in the las mesas area. this strategy seeks to reduce the effects of the water shortage crisis that jalisco has suffered in recent months. it is estimated that for the second stage of the program the system can be installed in 7 thousand homes.

title: monterrey zero waste
desc: project that directs the city of monterrey towards the implementation of zero waste management based on a circular economy, creating a healthier, cleaner, prosperous, sustainable and circular city benefiting all citizens of monterrey directly or indirectly and exercising the shared responsibility of government, citizenship, civil associations and companies. the general objective is to implement a management towards zero waste, diverting all possible msw from confinement, exploiting all possible alternatives so that citizens have different ways to dispose of their waste correctly and these can be obtained to reuse, compost or recycle. the specific objectives are: segregated collection, seeking to improve and accompany the municipal environmental route that passes through the houses, municipal collection centers, thus creating the alternative by delegation of taking your waste to spaces where it will be used instead of confining, information tools, to grow environmental awareness through workshops, communication campaigns,  to the creation of a waste inventory and strategic alliances, to strengthen collaboration with wma actors related to waste. likewise, a possible transfer center is being managed, which aims to receive, separate and process on site approximately 1000 tons of municipal solid waste and special management waste from the city of monterrey. for its economic sustainability it is considered the main sale of plastic pellets and preforms, biofuel, activated carbon, co2 as gas and activated carbon filter. however, this project is hardly in the scoping phases.

title: monterrey green parks and corridors system
desc: the system of parks and green corridors is a strategic instrument that concretizes the municipal commitment with respect to the conservation of green areas and biodiversity, and that promotes that the population knows the natural heritage, enjoys it and takes care of it. its general objective is to enhance ecological, environmental, social and economic services by connecting public spaces, vegetated areas and infrastructure for mobility to form a robust and effective ecological system. this policy contains actions to promote sustainable urban mobility, considers green areas and public space according to their different vocations, uses and scopes, integrates a progressive system to extend, connect and link it to other strategic urban systems such as public transport, sustainable mobility corridors and various strategic urban policies. as well as an interconnection of corridors at the metropolitan level between the municipality of monterrey and the municipalities of san pedro garza garcía, san nicolás de los garza and guadalupe, through the expansion of the sidewalks, universal accessibility, arborization with native species of the region, road signage, pedestrian and vehicular lighting, cycling infrastructure. it contains actions to promote sustainable urban mobility, universal accessibility, gender focus, transport-oriented development, resilience, recovery and environmental conservation.

title: streetlight
desc: in the municipality of mérida for public lighting, we have an approximate monthly energy consumption of 4,600,000 kwh with sodium vapor lamps, of this consumption 46.% is supplied by renewable energy, that is, 2,148,200 kwh by the geothermal company, the rest is supplied by cfe.la direction of public services within its commitment to ecology and the reduction of ghg gases,   began the gradual replacement of sodium vapor and metal additive lamps by led lamps, which consume about 40% to 50% less electrical energy and would have an impact on the reduction of co2 gases per power generation of 14.44 kg per month per replaced luminaire. with the change of led type luminaires, we could obtain better lighting at a lower cost and with lower co2 emission, which makes the use of energy in the field of public lighting for the municipality of mérida more efficient.

title: sustainable urban drainage systems for the great green lung of the city of mérida
desc: the project has 4 lines of work.- implementation of 10 suds, - implementation of suds in urban parks and primary roads - environmental education for the use and exploitation of water, and - improve the quality of rainwater that recharges the aquifer. two zones were identified for the implementation of the pilot and the executive projects for mérida 2000 avenues are being carried out and 132.se has the technical advice of the world resources institute (wri) mexico, in this line of work has gone from the conceptual idea to the identification of the possible suds to be implemented,  the sources and financial mechanism for the operation of the project.state of the financing, there are areas of the city council for the execution of work and maintenance, as well as image of contents, dissemination and environmental education. each with amounts destined for the operation its functions. for the implementation, a specific amount has been allocated by the public works directorate of the city council. for the implementation of the suds to the area of the great lung, financing and investment mechanisms are being explored with the advice of wri, mexico.at this moment the ordinary amounts already allocated are being used, with the expectation of obtaining extraordinary amounts or including these activities in the budget of the following year. project descriptionthis project is based on the identification that "water quality" is our main tension for urban resilience and the planning process of the green lung master plan of the west zone of the city of mérida.in 2017 the urban resilience profile for the city of mérida was carried out,  which identified impacts and tensions that were grouped into 11 priority topics of attention, highlighting the high levels of contamination of the aquifer by anthropogenic activities. in december 2018 it was carried out in the master plan of the great green lung of the city of mérida, this is made up of 4 axes of urban intervention: public space, sustainable urban mobility, social coexistence and environment. the environmental axis proposes to develop projects for flora, fauna, solid waste, energy efficiency, water and environmental education. regarding water, the implementation of sustainable urban drainage systems (suds) is proposed, therefore, in april of this year, the suds project for the great green lung was initiated. the objective is to implement sustainable urban drainage systems (suds) such as green ditches, areas of bio water retention, rain gardens and permeable floors in urban parks and roads in the area where the "great green lung of the city of mérida" is developed, as part of the actions aimed at urban water management that allow mitigating the impact of urban development on the aquifer and the problems of quantity / quality of urban runoff. the implementation of the suds will have a high environmental and social impact for 56 thousand households and more than 122,981 inhabitants (14.8% of total population), as it is located in one of the areas with the highest population and housing density, which concentrates urban parks with a high ecological, eco-archaeological and archaeal - botanical value. this project will allow rainwater to be collected, infiltrated and purified by bioremediation, mitigating the contamination of the aquifer and favoring its recharge in a natural way. it has already begun to generate improvements in small neighborhood parks in the area and to develop the preliminary projects of each intervention; if successfully implemented, these systems can be developed in the rest of the municipality. it is estimated that the cost for the implementation of 1 lds, would be approx $ 3,500 there is no total estimate of the project or the total cost of the investment

title: hydrological observatory that includes a real-time alert system in the metropolitan area of guadalajara (amg).
desc: the project arises from a proposal developed by the national center for disaster prevention (cenapred) together with the mexican institute of water technology (imta), who propose to imeplan to develop a hydrological observatory for the metropolitan area of guadalajara, which will contribute to the characterization of the danger associated with precipitation, as well as the definition of strategies for prevention,  emergency preparedness and response for severe storms and flooding. the intervention proposal consists of monitoring rainfall in high spatial and temporal resolution for the generation of timely alerts to improve emergency responses through the creation of a hydrological observatory for the amg (oh-amg), composed of a network of precipitation measurement equipment (weighing rain gauges, dysdrometers, anemometers and meteorological radar) and a web service for data visualization. scope of the project:1. to characterize the evolution of rainfall in the amg.2. monitor precipitation in real time for the issuance of alerts indicating its intensity and spatial distribution.3. provide reliable inputs, to induce the proper operation of the hydraulic infrastructure in order to reduce the impacts of flooding and flooding. total project cost: one hundred million mexican pesos
title+desc: hydrological observatory that includes a real-time alert system in the metropolitan area of guadalajara (amg).. the project arises from a proposal developed by the national center for disaster prevention (cenapred) together with the mexican institute of water technology (imta), who propose to imeplan to develop a hydrological observatory for the metropolitan area of guadalajara, which will contribute to the characterization of the danger associated with precipitation, as well as the definition of strategies for prevention,  emergency preparedness and response for severe storms and flooding. the intervention proposal consists of monitoring rainfall in high spatial and temporal resolution for the generation of timely alerts to improve emergency responses through the creation of a hydrological observatory for the amg (oh-amg), composed of a network of precipitation measurement equipment (weighing rain gauges, dysdrometers, anemometers and meteorological radar) and a web service for data visualization. scope of the project:1. to characterize the evolution of rainfall in the amg.2. monitor precipitation in real time for the issuance of alerts indicating its intensity and spatial distribution.3. provide reliable inputs, to induce the proper operation of the hydraulic infrastructure in order to reduce the impacts of flooding and flooding. total project cost: one hundred million mexican pesos

title: installation of wastewater treatment plants

title: municipal climate action plan of valle de santiago, gto.
desc: pacmun seeks to guide municipal public policies on mitigation and adaptation to the effects of climate change; in addition, the creation and strengthening of capacities of the various municipal actors is promoted through the development of a local instrument that allows them to identify the sources of greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions, the degree of vulnerability in their territory, as well as to find innovative and effective solutions to environmental management problems to mitigate emissions (iclei,  2022).

title: multisector environmental impact project in aquatic ecosystems of the metropolitan area of panama.
desc: for the reduction of flood risk in the juan díaz river basin, a series of measures have been defined, after the analysis of vulnerability and risks, including the construction of civil works to reduce the risk of flooding, such as rolling lagoons and dikes, as well as an improvement to the rainwater drainage system in its lower part.

title: implementation of bicycle paths and infrastructure (bicycle parking)
desc: within the context of covid-19, 46 km of emerging bike paths have been implemented within metropolitan roads. likewise, the current infrastructure of bicycle paths amounts to more than 204 km and the objective set by 2035 is to have more than 1000 km of bicycle paths that connect all metropolitan roads. ciclovía recreativa de la av. arequipa: it is a public space for the promotion of healthy lifestyle habits, sustainable transport and family integration activities which when interacting experience a change of attitude that contributes significantly to society. the goal is to achieve 52 closures of this space each year. without considering eventualities such as the pandemic that we are currently experiencing, and that has affected the normal development of the program from the fortnight of march to date. emerging bike paths: they are bicycle paths that are born as a result of immediate actions, which arise within the framework of tactical urbanism, as an alternative transport to reduce the risk of contagion by covid 19, in addition to this it provides more space and safety to cyclists in situations of danger or vulnerability in this sense, these emerging bike paths have been implemented in several cities around the world during the covid-19 pandemic in order to help cyclists to maintain social distance to minimize the risk of contagion, in addition to other collateral benefits, including curbing the indiscriminate use of the private vehicle strengthening non-motorized transport that provides benefits to health, the economy and the environment. execution of bicycle paths and bicycle parking: from non-motorized transport will be executed during these two years (2020 and 2021) the following projects, in different stages: i stage of emerging bicycle paths: it is composed of 46 km and 12 parking lots, comprising 11 sections that will facilitate cycling in the north, south, east and west areas. in addition, complementary measures will be implemented, such as the installation of traffic lights for cyclists, reduction of speed to 40km / h of the lane adjacent to the bicycle paths and tactical urban planning interventionsii stage of emerging bicycle paths it is composed of 52 km and 20 parking lots, comprising 16 sections that will facilitate cycling. short term projectsnew bike pathsit is composed of new bike paths in san juan title: implement a new smart irrigation system in the parks and gardens of the city of lima.
desc: a complete preliminary study of the characterization of the risks of parks and gardens will be developed, in order to implement a new system of management of the same with an intelligent irrigation system in the city of lima.the parks and gardens of metropolitan lima would be equipped with a system of sensors and controllers that measure the climatic variables (temperature,  precipitation, soil moisture and wind speed) and inform about the need for water that plants may have. this information is transmitted to a gis system (geographic information system) where municipal technicians manage irrigation in real time from their computer and detect incidents such as breakdowns or breakdowns.
title+desc: implement a new smart irrigation system in the parks and gardens of the city of lima.. a complete preliminary study of the characterization of the risks of parks and gardens will be developed, in order to implement a new system of management of the same with an intelligent irrigation system in the city of lima.the parks and gardens of metropolitan lima would be equipped with a system of sensors and controllers that measure the climatic variables (temperature,  precipitation, soil moisture and wind speed) and inform about the need for water that plants may have. this information is transmitted to a gis system (geographic information system) where municipal technicians manage irrigation in real time from their computer and detect incidents such as breakdowns or breakdowns.

title: progressive modernization of solid waste management
desc: this measure aims to improve and expand the collection of solid waste in the historic center of lima, including the implementation of electric vehicles for its transfer. likewise, implement a municipal solid waste treatment and recovery plant in an available area of the property where the "el zapallal" landfill is located, including the progressive construction of infrastructures for the material and energy recovery of municipal organic solid waste, as well as the implementation of other technologies.  global green growth institute, embassy of the netherlands, educational institutions and other actors the progressive modernization of solid waste management in order to improve solid waste management systems with the sustainability approach.
title+desc: progressive modernization of solid waste management. this measure aims to improve and expand the collection of solid waste in the historic center of lima, including the implementation of electric vehicles for its transfer. likewise, implement a municipal solid waste treatment and recovery plant in an available area of the property where the "el zapallal" landfill is located, including the progressive construction of infrastructures for the material and energy recovery of municipal organic solid waste, as well as the implementation of other technologies.  global green growth institute, embassy of the netherlands, educational institutions and other actors the progressive modernization of solid waste management in order to improve solid waste management systems with the sustainability approach.

title: wastewater treatment plants of the municipal corporation
desc: the municipality of lima has 3 wastewater treatment plants, two in zonal parks and one on main roads. it is necessary to operate these plants for the use of treated water in the green areas of the city. the importance of this operation lies in the fact that at the moment, the municipality is using drinking water for the irrigation of parks and gardens of the cercado de lima, this brings with it a lower availability of this scarce good for domestic consumption. the objective is to achieve the reuse of treated wastewater for the irrigation of parks and gardens and prioritize the use of drinking water for human consumption. the start-up of these 3 treatment plants will allow the irrigation of 30% of the zonal parks of the metropolitan area and 100% of the parks of the cercado district of lima. the treatment plants are located in the cercado district of lima

title: naturaliza miraflores
desc: the naturaliza miraflores program is proposed in four lines of action related to the preservation of the fauna and flora of the district: urban beekeeping, wings and waves, biologist for a day and naturalize from the nest, all of them focused on creating awareness among citizens about the importance and need for a harmonious coexistence with nature in the city,  the benefits of this and the good practices we can do to achieve a sustainable urban ecosystem. it has been carried out combining different activities such as workshops, talks, seminars, fairs, face-to-face and conditioning during the time of national quarantine to the virtual modality. the purpose of this program has been institutionalized with the creation of its own logo which has been present in all the activities of the program also through ordinance 536 of march 9, 2020 "ordinance that promotes the conservation of bees and other pollinators in the district of miraflores"*the total cost of the project is in pen.

title: wastewater treatment plant for irrigation of green areas
desc: the district of miraflores has 1,131,714.17 m2 of green areas, among which are the 75 parks, gardens, docks and cliff of the green coast, of which only 20% have technical irrigation. for this reason, the technical project of irrigation execution was proposed and thus reduce water consumption in the district.*the total cost of the project is in pen.

title: installation of lighting equipment for green areas from urban solar energy.
desc: in june 2020, the municipality of san isidro, through the sub-management of environmental management, started a pilot project in which it consisted of acquiring 51 solar panels with led lights and installing them in the pedestrian pathways of sector 2 of the district. its operation has avoided emitting 14.27 tons of carbon dioxide equivalent to date. likewise, and as the first stage of this project, the municipality of san isidro, also through the sub-management of environmental management, is proposing to install 221 solar lights with additional led panels in the month of september of this year in subsector 4- 3 of the district, which would be equivalent to a reduction of 61.83 tons of equivalent greenhouse effect gases per year. then, and following the limiting conditions and specified in law no. 25844, electricity concessions law and its regulations approved by supreme decree no. 009-93-em, the municipality of san isidro will carry out signed agreements, prior coordination with the corresponding concessionaire, on the installation of public lighting units fed with renewable sources in the 46 parks of the district and whose lighting levels exceed the established minimums that include aspects related to energy  consumption, operation, maintenance and replacement of units. it should be reiterated that the municipality would assume the costs of the excess installation, energy consumption, operation, maintenance and replacement of lighting units with respect to the costs for these same concepts of units. for its part, the concessionaire would be in charge of ensuring that the installation of special public lighting of renewable origin does not affect the lighting standards established for the parks. the purpose of signing these agreements with the respective concessionaire is to enable by the year 2050 new solar panels with led lights to the 46 parks that currently exist in the san isidro district; and, with this, avoid the emission of 122,434 tons of carbon dioxide equivalent annually until that year.

title: canalization project plan to improve the water supply for green areas in the santiago de surco district
desc: surco has its ragadio channel exposed, which is bringing public health problems in summer due to the proliferation of mosquito vectors of diseases such as chikynguya among others, in addition to overflows in times of intense rains in the central sierra. for all these reasons, its channeling is remade throughout its route within the district.

title: program of segregation at the source and selective collection of reusable inorganic solid waste with responsibility and social inclusion for recyclers with disabilities in the district of ate
desc: properly manage waste by implementing the segregation program at source. labor inclusion of people with disabilities with the aim of improving their quality of life and their family environment. the activities planned to address the long-term project need are:1. develop programs that promote social inclusion with people with disabilities.2. promote environmental education awareness campaigns3. improve the infrastructure of the valuation plant.

title: cycle path in jesus mary
desc: for the improvement of the district's cycle system, integral maintenance of the 10.5 km of existing cycle lanes is required, as well as the extension of the network on garzón avenue (crossroad to the district). the project includes both vertical and horizontal signaling (traffic paint and reflective tacks) of the entire cycle network, as well as the installation of 14 bicycle stations and the acquisition of bicycles for each point.

title: jesus maria wastewater treatment plant
desc: the treatment plant for the irrigation waters of the huatica river (ptar) in the district of jesus maria will provide the district with treated good quality, free of solid waste, thus complying with the current regulations on water quality for irrigation purposes. this plant will allow water quality to be improved, ensuring the health of humans and animals, water will be treated by sedimentation and chlorination to irrigate green areas. it also seeks to protect public health due to the contamination of irrigation waters with bacteria and viruses that transmit diseases and, finally, seeks to protect the environment.

title: improvement of the infrastructure of the ecological park of la molina
desc: the public investment project called "improvement of the public infrastructure of the forest ecological park n°1 la molina del distrito de la molina - province of lima - department of lima" with unique investment code n° 2511680, is a project designed to create and improve public spaces for recreation in contact with nature for residents of the district of la molina and other districts who want to visit it. the improvement of this public space is of utmost importance for recreation, socialization and even for the economy of our community. given the threat of covid-19, the operation, requirements and characteristics of this public space are put under analysis in order to implement and improve areas suitable for family enjoyment, in the context of the pandemic and for the future. the main components that will be developed as a result of the execution of this project are:oimplementation of water and drainage network.oimplementation of electrical networkoimplementation of administrative officesoimplementation of emergency topicoimplementation of office of civil defense oimplementation of amphitheaterimplementation of hygienic servicesoimplementation of solar lighting systemimplementation of barbecue areaimplementation of area of activities  sportsomini farm improvementocoo greenhouse improvementoexpanding of the parking areaoimplementation of rest points or improvement of main viewpoints of the parking lotimplementation of signage, bins, among others. the area of influence of the project covers approximately 10 hectares of the ecological park and the capacity of attention to visitors will be tripled. the infrastructure to be installed is in accordance with the rustic nature of the park, being mostly wooden environments and solar lighting in the areas conducive to its use. also, in order to maintain the security of the park, an internal video surveillance system will be implemented where it will be possible to identify if any person is committing any act that risks their own safety and that of others or that may be damaging the infrastructure or the green area of the park. green spaces are important public spaces in most cities. they offer solutions to the impact of rapid and unsustainable urbanization on health and well-being. the social and economic benefits of urban green spaces are of global concern as they relate to mitigating climate change and other priorities set out in the sdgs, including sustainable cities, public health and nature conservation.

title: landscape, social, urban and environmental recovery of barrio los pescadores
desc: the development of this proposal will allow the social and productive inclusion of the community of the los pescadores neighborhood adjacent to la salina de pamapatar, through a special program of restructuring and urban renewal; popular commercial boulevards and their respective landscape, architectural and urban planning treatments; development of social housing complexes, if recommended suspended from the ground level as a prevention of potential floods and ecological trails. covid-19 has delayed the start of the project
